The goal is for you to quickly understand what the course topics will entail."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What are security auditing and compliance?","timeRequired":"PT3M16S","description":"This video will explain what security auditing and compliance are. This will be broken down with a clear understanding of each."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Why do organizations need to be audited?","timeRequired":"PT2M59S","description":"After watching this video, you'll understand not only what security auditing is, but why security auditing is required. The reasons for auditing and compliance will be broken down. This will help you ensure that you understand the measures that need to be in place to protect your data."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Who can be a security auditor?","timeRequired":"PT4M2S","description":"After watching this video, you'll be aware that anyone can be an auditor if they have a passion for it. There are no technical requirements to be a successful auditor."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Overview of common security frameworks","timeRequired":"PT2M42S","description":"This video covers a high level of some of the most common security frameworks. After watching this video, you'll understand that there are many different paths and frameworks for security auditing."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"NIST security framework","timeRequired":"PT5M39S","description":"This video will cover the NIST framework specifically. You'll learn about the different types of NIST security frameworks."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"PCI security frameworks","timeRequired":"PT3M9S","description":"This video will educate you on the PCI (Payment Card Industry) standards that are wrapped around companies that transmit credit card data. After watching this video, you'll understand what the framework is for and understand the different controls within the framework."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How to land your first security auditing position","timeRequired":"PT4M18S","description":"This video will teach you what to learn and how to prepare yourself to land your first role in security auditing. Not all CISOs are technical today but all the successful ones understand the fundamentals of cybersecurity."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What does a CISO do?","timeRequired":"PT2M43S","description":"Explore the different hats a CISO needs to wear on any given day and what it means to be a CISO before deciding to pursue this career path."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What type of CISO do you want to be?","timeRequired":"PT3M59S","description":"Explore the two types of organizations and three potential types of CISOs in each organization. By understanding what type of CISO you want to be, you can hone in on the type of experiences you need and opportunities to pursue."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Before the interview","timeRequired":"PT3M36S","description":"This video provides insight into how most CISOs get hired. Understanding the hiring process can help you build the profile and relationships needed to get your first CISO role."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"The CISO resume","timeRequired":"PT1M51S","description":"Learn how to tell your story on paper in a manner that gets the attention of the reader and hiring managers."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"The CISO interview","timeRequired":"PT3M27S","description":"This video helps you prepare for the CISO interview once you land it."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"First 90 days","timeRequired":"PT3M25S","description":"The first 90 days are the most critical to any leadership position and, when it comes to a CISO, it's especially important to get off to a great start. In this video, get a clear picture of what that start of your tenure should entail."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Select a security framework","timeRequired":"PT4M12S","description":"Learn how to choose a standard to assess the maturity of your new security organization against. This framework is important because it is the foundation for the security program you, as the CISO, build and operate."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Complete an assessment","timeRequired":"PT3M2S","description":"In this video, learn the process of selecting an assessor, bringing them in, and conducting a thorough gap assessment. This is important because the initial assessment is your one time to provide the current state of the organization that you as the new CISO have inherited and for you to quickly understand the risks and exposure."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Prioritize areas for improvement","timeRequired":"PT3M15S","description":"This video explains how to narrow down the gaps to the ones with the greatest return on investment. It's common to want to address all the issues, but it's not feasible, issues abound and the process to prioritize is integral to creating an achievable action plan."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Set a mission and vision for your department","timeRequired":"PT1M31S","description":"In this video, learn why the security teams exist and develop an ideal target state for the program. This is often a constant in most successful security programs because it provides a north star for everyone to work toward."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Put it on paper and socialize","timeRequired":"PT2M20S","description":"In this video, learn many different ways you can document, present, and develop support for the cybersecurity strategy. The cybersecurity strategy is important but if you don't have buy-in and support it throughout the ranks, as it will fail. You want to learn how to prevent that."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Relationship building","timeRequired":"PT3M34S","description":"In this video, discover the basics of building relationships as a CISO, including which relationships you should build first for short- and long-term success as a CISO. It is important to understand what the role looks like on a daily basis in order to help you decide if it's for you."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What are the different types of data analytics?","timeRequired":"PT4M24S","description":"After this video, you will understand the different types of DA roles and how they can vary across industries and companies. Every role is different in tasks and tools, so there is a lot of room to customize and figure out what is best and most exciting to you!"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Should you be a data analyst?","timeRequired":"PT2M52S","description":"After this video, you will have a better understanding of who should be a DA, and more importantly, who shouldn't. This course isn't designed to convince everyone to be a DA, it is designed to provide honesty so people can make the best decision for them."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How much work does it take to be a data analyst?","timeRequired":"PT3M14S","description":"By the end of this video, you will gain insight into the whole process of becoming a data analyst from start to finish. Although you don't have to be a mathematician to be a DA, basic stats are necessary to work with data and make the right decisions."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How to learn basic data skills for data analytics","timeRequired":"PT2M52S","description":"At the end of this video, you will understand the basic data skills needed to become a DA. Understanding the basics of data is vital before you start to work with data."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How to learn Power BI and Tableau for data analytics","timeRequired":"PT3M50S","description":"After this video, you will understand the basic options for BI visualization, why it's important, and how to choose the best tool for you. BI viz is the best place to start learning since it requires little coding and helps you understand important data skills."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How to learn SQL for data analytics","timeRequired":"PT4M1S","description":"At the end of this video, you will understand the basics of relational databases, data models, and writing queries. SQL is a skill that is required for most DA jobs because it is a widely-accepted tool used to build datasets and wrangle data."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How to learn programming in Python or R for data analytics","timeRequired":"PT3M19S","description":"At the end of this video, you will understand the two most common programming languages in DA‚ÄîPython and R‚Äîand know which tool is best for you. Although these skills are optional for most DA jobs, they can help you stand out on the job market, obtain higher-level positions, and allow you to perform more advanced analyses."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"LinkedIn profile: First impressions","timeRequired":"PT4M37S","description":"By the end of this video, you will understand how to set up and optimize your LinkedIn profile by adding a professional headshot and cover photo, as well as an inviting headline. Having a professional and inviting LinkedIn profile is vital in today's job market because it can impact how recruiters view you."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"LinkedIn profile: Skills, experience, and recommendations","timeRequired":"PT2M22S"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How to build a personal brand for data analytics","timeRequired":"PT3M3S","description":"At the end of this video, you will understand the importance of building a personal brand, how to present yourself as a DA on LinkedIn, and how it helps you in the job market. A personal brand will help you stand out, learn from the community, build credibility, and gain visibility in the industry."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How to maximize LinkedIn and network for data analytics","timeRequired":"PT2M41S","description":"At the end of this video, you will understand how to build connections, message others, set up coffee chats, and build community with other data professionals. Having a good network is vital for landing a job and continuing to grow."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How to get interviews for data analytics","timeRequired":"PT2M42S","description":"By the end of this video, you will understand the challenges of getting interviews and how to overcome them. Getting interviews with no experience is very difficult, but you can increase your success by building connections on LinkedIn and having a great resume and portfolio."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What is a data analytics portfolio?","timeRequired":"PT3M16S","description":"After watching this video, you will have a concrete understanding of what a data portfolio is and why it is important for the job search."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How and where to build a portfolio","timeRequired":"PT2M39S","description":"After watching this video, you will have a concrete understanding of where to build an analytics portfolio."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How to pick projects related to the role and industry","timeRequired":"PT3M43S","description":"By the end of this video, you'll have a good understanding of how to build a data portfolio, what to include in your portfolio, and how to tailor it to your target role and industry. Explore different options for portfolios or different ways of presenting your projects."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How to leverage a portfolio in interviews","timeRequired":"PT2M45S","description":"By the end of this video, you will understand how to use your tailored projects to show hiring managers that you have the necessary skills to succeed in the role and industry you are interviewing for. Communicating your value to a hiring manager is one of the most difficult parts of interviewing, but it is necessary to show them that you can be successful on their team."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Start upskilling, networking, and building a portfolio","timeRequired":"PT1M28S","description":"At the end of this video, you will have a good overview of when and how to start this journey. Security isn't just the responsibility of one team; security is everyone's responsibility."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Determine how important security is at your company","timeRequired":"PT1M59S","description":"How is security thought about at your organization? Is security everyone's responsibility? Does security have the visibility across the company and a seat at the executive table? This challenge allows students to evaluate those statements."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Start building trust today","timeRequired":"PT1M54S","description":"In this video, learn how to build evidence for or against the statement \"security is important at my company\"."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Unconventional talent is everywhere","timeRequired":"PT2M29S","description":"The opera singer, the librarian, the baker. Unconventional talent is everywhere; you just have to know where to look. In this video, learn where to look for unconventional talent and what to look for."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Hire for potential","timeRequired":"PT2M4S","description":"If you want to win in the future, you need to start hiring for potential today. Learn why hiring for potential has a better long-term return than hiring for experience."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Ask better questions to get better answers","timeRequired":"PT2M37S","description":"Is your current set of interview questions holding you back from finding true talent? It may be. In this video, learn how asking better questions leads to better answers."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Challenge: Reflect on your interview questions","timeRequired":"PT1M26S","description":"In this critical thinking exercise, grade your current list of interview questions against a set of rubrics."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Myth number one: You must have years of experience first","timeRequired":"PT2M5S","description":"People say there's no such thing as entry-level in cybersecurity. In this video, see that every job in cybersecurity includes entry-level work and that you don't need years of experience in a related IT field to become a cybersecurity professional."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Myth number two: Cybersecurity is difficult to learn","timeRequired":"PT2M36S","description":"In this video, learn how the cybersecurity industry has evolved into one that is much easier to learn, simply because there are more lessons and teachers to learn from."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Myth number three: You need IT fundamentals","timeRequired":"PT1M45S","description":"You don't need to know everything about everything in cybersecurity. Even experts don't know everything. In this video, learn which fundamentals are needed in cybersecurity and which are not."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Challenge: What other myths exist?","timeRequired":"PT1M54S","description":"There are many things in cybersecurity assumed to be true; what other assumptions can be challenged? In this critical thinking exercise, tease apart a previously known fact about cybersecurity and begin to challenge it."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Job descriptions that get you what you want","timeRequired":"PT2M5S","description":"In this video, learn the purpose of job descriptions and how to write them so you get great candidates early in the hiring pipeline. Great job descriptions result in a diverse pipeline, and the studies and data back that up."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What great candidates look for","timeRequired":"PT2M10S","description":"In this video, learn what top talent in the cybersecurity market is looking for in a company and in a job description."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Challenge: Review your most recent job description","timeRequired":"PT1M32S","description":"In this challenge, review your most recent job posting and compare it to the good job description examples shown in lesson four."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"The purpose of technical interviews","timeRequired":"PT2M12S","description":"In this video, learn the purpose of technical interviews and what technical interviews are trying to uncover in candidates. The old way of doing interviews is outdated and is actually hurting your ability to find and attract the talent that you need."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Take-home projects: A better way","timeRequired":"PT1M56S","description":"In this video, learn how take-home projects can replace the need for the technical interview, and how take-home projects are a better option to determine technical skill. Examine an example project in detail."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"The first 90 days: The most important period","timeRequired":"PT1M51S","description":"The first 90 days of any new job are the most important for a new hire; it is the period of time that sets up the new hire for either success or failure. In this video, learn how to set your new hires up for success in the first 90 days."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Three habits of the highly effective cybersecurity manager","timeRequired":"PT1M32S","description":"Learn the three habits of highly effective cybersecurity managers. Discover what he'll cover in the course, including the cybersecurity marketplace and where you‚Äôre most likely to find jobs, the most common careers, and the most in-demand and relevant cybersecurity certifications."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Who this course is for","timeRequired":"PT1M36S","description":"In this video, Marc Menninger describes who the Cybersecurity Careers and Certifications course is for and what you'll learn by taking it. Explore how this course covers what it takes to be a successful cybersecurity professional. Discover the three types of people who will get the most benefit from this course."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Why start a career in cybersecurity?","timeRequired":"PT1M52S","description":"In this video, Marc Menninger describes five major reasons why you might want to consider a career in cybersecurity. Learn about the \"security premium\" and why cybersecurity professionals can get paid more than their IT counterparts. Discover unique aspects of cybersecurity jobs that make them compelling to anyone interested in career growth."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"A brief history of cybersecurity","timeRequired":"PT4M41S","description":"In this video, Marc Menninger reviews some key events in cybersecurity history. Understand how the internet was first developed with the launch of ARPANET and TCP/IP. Learn about key United States legislation related to data security, like HIPAA, GLBA, and California's data breach law. Marc also discusses the launch of industry standards like PCI/DSS and ISO/IEC 27001."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"An overview of cybersecurity key concepts","timeRequired":"PT4M22S","description":"In this video, Marc Menninger describes four key concepts in a cybersecurity career. Explore CIA (confidentiality, integrity, and availability), which is also referred to as the CIA triangle or CIA triad. Understand how to determine security best practices. Learn about the concept of defense in depth. And finally, Marc explains policies, standards, procedures, and guidelines."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Enabling technologies for cybersecurity","timeRequired":"PT3M58S","description":"In this video, Marc Menninger describes three enabling technologies for cybersecurity professionals. Get an overview of IP networking concepts as well as common IP network attacks. Learn what you need to know about firewall key concepts and common attacks. And finally, explore cryptography key concepts and common attacks."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Understanding cybersecurity threats","timeRequired":"PT1M44S","description":"In this video, Marc Menninger describes some of the most common threats in cybersecurity. Learn why it's important to be aware of these threats and discover time-proven methods for reducing their impacts. Explore cybersecurity threats like the Internet of Things (IoT), cloud-based attacks, ransomware, cryptojacking, and more."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Cybersecurity career resources","timeRequired":"PT3M32S","description":"In this video, Marc Menninger describes resources that can enhance the career of cybersecurity professionals. Learn about general resources like the NIST CSRC, CERIAS, and the SANS Reading Room. Explore other helpful security resources like news and blog sites, security podcasts, free security training, and security books."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Government (FISMA)","timeRequired":"PT2M49S","description":"In this video, Marc Menninger describes why the US federal government is a strong marketplace for cybersecurity professionals. Learn how the Federal Information Security Management Act (FISMA) requires federal agencies to be secure. Explore why federal agencies are prime cyberattack targets. Understand the steps the federal government is taking to improve cybersecurity."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Financial institutions (GLBA)","timeRequired":"PT2M49S","description":"In this video, Marc Menninger describes why financial institutions are a strong marketplace for cybersecurity professionals. Learn how the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLBA) requires financial institutions to be secure. Explore why financial institutions are prime cyberattack targets. Understand why the demand for cybersecurity professionals from financial institutions is growing."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Healthcare (HIPAA)","timeRequired":"PT2M51S","description":"In this video, Marc Menninger describes why healthcare organizations are a strong marketplace for cybersecurity professionals. Learn how the Healthcare Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) requires healthcare organizations to be secure. Explore why healthcare organizations are prime cyberattack targets. Understand why the demand for cybersecurity professionals from healthcare organizations is growing."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Corporate (SOX)","timeRequired":"PT2M15S","description":"In this video, Marc Menninger describes why corporations are a strong marketplace for cybersecurity professionals. Learn how the Sarbanes‚ÄìOxley Act (SOX) requires corporations to be secure. Explore why corporations are prime cyberattack targets. Understand why the demand for cybersecurity professionals from corporations is growing."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Retail (PCI DSS)","timeRequired":"PT2M55S","description":"In this video, Marc Menninger describes why retailers are a strong marketplace for cybersecurity professionals. Learn how the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) requires retailers to be secure. Explore why retailers are prime cyberattack targets. Understand why the demand for cybersecurity professionals from retailers is growing."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Analytical and technology savvy","timeRequired":"PT2M38S","description":"In this video, Marc Menninger describes two traits that will contribute to your success as a cybersecurity professional. Learn why having analytical skills is desired by employers and ways you can tell if you're an analytical person. Discover why being tech savvy is a beneficial trait and how you can tell if you're tech savvy."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Self-directed and knowledge hungry","timeRequired":"PT2M41S","description":"In this video, Marc Menninger describes two traits that will contribute to your success as a cybersecurity professional. Learn why being self-directed is desired by employers and ways you can be more self-directed. Discover why there's always more to learn in the cybersecurity field and why having the desire to learn is a beneficial trait."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Collaborative and works well with others","timeRequired":"PT1M56S","description":"In this video, Marc Menninger describes two traits that will contribute to your success as a cybersecurity professional. Learn why collaborating with others is essential in your cybersecurity role. And discover why it's important to work well with others, especially when situations aren't going your way."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Cybersecurity careers overview","timeRequired":"PT2M32S","description":"In this video, Marc Menninger introduces the nine main job categories that exist in the cybersecurity field: specialist, often also called technician, analyst, auditor, consultant, engineer, administrator, architect, manager, and director. Learn about the different levels and sub-roles within each of these jobs."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Cybersecurity career: Specialist or technician","timeRequired":"PT3M3S","description":"In this video, Marc Menninger describes key roles and jobs performed by cybersecurity specialists and technicians. This video explores how to use the three future career tools in order to be successful in these new roles."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"The new workplace","timeRequired":"PT2M19S","description":"Research states that 85% of the jobs today's people will do during their life have not been invented yet. Trending for data science jobs aligns with this statistic. In this video, explore the historical evolution of technology's impact on job creation over the past 350 years as well as insight into where opportunities may appear in the future."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"A brief history of machines helping humans","timeRequired":"PT1M22S","description":"To understand the broader historical context of innovation, this video describes specifics about the impact of technologies like moveable type and mechanized knitting machines in transforming business and culture. This video provides a longitudinal perspective to help data scientists better understand how technological innovations have been applied in the past as well as implications for both near term and future applications."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Data throughout history","timeRequired":"PT2M58S","description":"Humans have been solving data-related problems for centuries and this process is going to continue in the decades ahead. This video explores how various approaches laid the groundwork for how data science evolves."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Data science drives Wall Street and Main Street","timeRequired":"PT2M13S","description":"Data science is increasingly critical to how organizations generate attributable revenue, take market share, improve productivity, and make an organization more efficient. Connecting myriad orthogonal data sets regardless of vertical or discipline can enable companies to make smarter business decisions. In this video, gain insight into the role data science plays in delivering positive business outcomes."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Where is all the data coming from?","timeRequired":"PT2M24S","description":"Factors contributing to growth in the data science field include increasing computing power, smaller faster mobile solutions, the growing deluge of data, AI, the Internet of Things‚Äîto name a few. This video provides an overview of near-term growth areas that represent opportunities for data scientists."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Businesses of the future","timeRequired":"PT1M37S","description":"Future data science careers are in disciplines that have not historically connected, or perhaps even existed! This video provides insight into potential data science opportunities based on evolving intersections driving future business models."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Managing the emerging data science job market","timeRequired":"PT1M37S","description":"Now, more than ever, getting the job is the job. You have to know where the jobs are and they are increasingly in unlikely places. This video provides an overview of a codified process to enable data scientists to navigate the new workplace paradigm successfully."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Three tools to navigate your career(s)","timeRequired":"PT2M3S","description":"The three future career tools help you define your unique value prop, find conversations that are appropriate, and connect with people and companies critical to successful data science careers. In this video, discover how these three tools work and how they can help you proactively manage your career or careers."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What is your VOICE?","timeRequired":"PT1M32S","description":"Identifying and promoting personal skills and interest areas is critical to successful careers in the decades ahead. This video provides insight into the importance and evolution of a personal brand and explores how it has evolved over the past decade driven by social media, the gig economy, and globalization."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"The importance of brand","timeRequired":"PT2M13S"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Your personal brand","timeRequired":"PT1M11S","description":"An ideation technique that leverages a favorite movie, book, TV show, or game allows you to clearly define a personal brand and value proposition. In this video, learn how to articulate the criteria that make up your own VOICE, which is a critical success factor in the new workplace paradigm."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Identify your interests","timeRequired":"PT1M35S","description":"Write down your favorite book, TV show, movie, or game based on its attributes that resonate with you. Learn how to build a table to capture stimuli and attributes."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Identify your triggers","timeRequired":"PT1M27S"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Building your VOICE table","timeRequired":"PT1M52S"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"That is what I can do, that nobody else can do","timeRequired":"PT1M11S"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"ANTENNA overview","timeRequired":"PT2M3S","description":"In today's content-rich media environment, finding valuable data science conversations is critically important. Knowing where people are sharing ideas based on your own VOICE characteristics is key to successfully navigating the new workplace paradigm. This video provides an overview of how the ANTENNA activity can help."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Where are the conversations happening?","timeRequired":"PT2M28S"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Building the new career grid","timeRequired":"PT1M42S","description":"The ANTENNA activity enables source selection, content, and channel identification, as well as the frequency with which each one is monitored. This video provides insight into identifying and managing a defined number of sources and channels that link to your VOICE attributes."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Start developing your ANTENNA","timeRequired":"PT1M41S","description":"Creating a weekly journal of insights around trending in data science and possible attendant job opportunities makes navigating the career path much simpler. In this video, discover how to capture and monitor relevant trending based on your own talents and interests and what organization and vertical a new career might be in."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Keep a journal","timeRequired":"PT1M19S","description":"Learn how to build a matrix that identifies two to three sources based on VOICE attributes. Discover how to list the sources, get a description of each one, and get a proposed frequency for monitoring each source."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How ANTENNA helped me","timeRequired":"PT1M58S","description":"In this video, explore an example of how the instructor has built their own ANTENNA matrix and how often they check the various sources based on value and the editorial calendar."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"It is not what you know, but who you know","timeRequired":"PT2M38S","description":"Building a future-focused mega-network is critically important in today's global borderless workplace. Successful data scientists need a robust and constantly growing network professional contacts. This video shows how the MESH exercise provides guidance on how to effectively find and connect with actual people in the field you are interested in, based on your VOICE characteristics and your ANTENNA grid conversations."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"The office of the future","timeRequired":"PT2M4S","description":"Exploiting relationships can increase awareness of your VOICE and enhance your ability to influence and be employed. This video provides insight into how to leverage and expand your network‚Äîbased on whom you know and whom they know‚Äîand explores the exponential power using a range of tools like LinkedIn, Twitter, and Instagram."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Cast a wide net","timeRequired":"PT2M10S"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Following thought leaders and leading-edge groups","timeRequired":"PT1M40S","description":"Systematically tracking down relevant groups to join and specific people that you may not know can widen the aperture when investigating data science job opportunities This video provides guidance for the next part of the MESH activity. Network expansion is a never-ending job and a critical component for success in the new workplace model."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Start building your MESH on LinkedIn","timeRequired":"PT1M37S"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Connect with people on LinkedIn","timeRequired":"PT2M18S"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Connect with groups on LinkedIn","timeRequired":"PT1M38S"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"In-person interactions","timeRequired":"PT1M33S","description":"In-person interaction continues to be a driver of human networking and idea-sharing. Discovering and attending in-person events, conferences, meetups, as well as hosting your own can expand your influence and grow your MESH. In this video, explore concrete ideas for tracking down appropriate live events to expand the impact of your VOICE and lay the additional groundwork for future career connections."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Keeping track of your connections with a CRM","timeRequired":"PT1M11S","description":"Using the VOICE and ANTENNA criteria for guidance, select five people to connect with using LinkedIn or a Google Search, two to three people or organizations to follow on Twitter, two or three groups to join on LinkedIn, and two to three local meetups to join and attend."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Connecting is an equal exchange","timeRequired":"PT1M28S","description":"In this video, explore the instructor's list and learn about the criteria they used to select them."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How to start building your MESH by cold-calling","timeRequired":"PT1M54S"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Prepare for future data-science careers","timeRequired":"PT1M9S","description":"Tremendous opportunities lie ahead for data scientists. They can have an impact across a range of new business models as well as on culture and society writ large, such as curing cancer or taking humans to other planets. This video makes it clear that they are empowered to drive important changes and that interesting roles await them."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"It's not about the tools","timeRequired":"PT1M13S","description":"As the global economy continues to change, data scientists are uniquely positioned to provide strategic guidance to help businesses solve problems that don't exist yet. In this video, discover how to move up the value chain to contribute more strategically, be more creative, and continue to do interesting work."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Next steps","timeRequired":"PT1M2S","description":"Corporate management guru Peter Drucker famously said, \"Don't tell me you had a great meeting with me, tell me what you are going to do differently on Monday.\" In the spirit of that guidance, learn how to take the insight you gained from this course and use it to create stuff that is going to look like magic. This video is designed to inspire and excite data scientists about what lies ahead."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":29,"ratingValue":4.6,"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},"review":[{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"JEAN   SERGE NGOMA","jobTitle":"Senior Oil & Gas Financial Operations Analyst / Financial Planning & Wealth Management (FPWM)‚Ñ¢","url":"https://lu.linkedin.com/in/jean-serge-ngoma"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":5},"reviewBody":"EXCELLENT","datePublished":"2022-02-04T18:26:27.066Z","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"LinkedIn"},"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1}],"video":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Data science is disrupting every business - Future Proofing Your Data Science Career","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Chris Bishop","description":"TEDx Speaker | Qubit Confidential host | Workplace futurist | Bass player for Ion Maiden","jobTitle":"TEDx Speaker | Qubit Confidential host | Workplace futurist | Bass player for Ion Maiden","url":"https://www.linkedin.com/in/christopherbishop123","image":"https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/v2/D4D03AQGris2ezFPgpw/profile-displayphoto-shrink_400_400/profile-displayphoto-shrink_400_400/0/1714661783954?e=2147483647&v=beta&t=Wk6xHdxmH7ojsMSG7toH6IwuRATHaZJW2jF5AZN2lTk"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/v2/C4E0DAQFtWaR4WcYp3g/learning-public-crop_675_1200/learning-public-crop_675_1200/0/1588090928525?e=2147483647&v=beta&t=Nb1NSwbCMrpy37dA9I3slqRltA3NHAHHT0rQTuAGzhM","description":"Learn what the future holds for data science professionals and the skills you need for a successful and sustainable career.","duration":"PT1M49S","datePublished":"2020-04-30","uploadDate":"2020-04-30","requiresSubscription":false,"isAccessibleForFree":true,"contentUrl":"https://www.linkedin.com/learning/future-proofing-your-data-science-career/data-science-is-disrupting-every-business"},"educationalLevel":"Beginner"}

This course can help you understand what is involved in being a cloud architect, how it differs from other architecture roles, how it differs from being a cloud developer, and specific topics, patterns, systems, and requirements involved in working as a cloud architect."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Become a cloud architect","timeRequired":"PT2M42S","description":"In this video, examine the key questions you need to ask yourself before embarking on the journey from cloud developer to cloud architect."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Why architecting in the cloud is different","timeRequired":"PT2M34S","description":"In this video, discover why building and architecting a cloud application is different from a non-cloud application. What makes architecting a cloud-based application and architecting infrastructure for these applications different than in the past?"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Differences between developer and architect","timeRequired":"PT1M48S","description":"In this video, examine the difference between a cloud developer and a cloud architect, and why cloud architecture is critical to the logical development of a cloud-based application."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Specific requirements for a cloud architect","timeRequired":"PT4M33S","description":"What are the requirements for becoming a cloud architect? What experience do you need? What skills are hiring managers looking for? What are the job requirements? What training is available?"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Cloud architect topics","timeRequired":"PT1M44S","description":"What are some of the topics that are important to learn and understand before you can take on the role of a cloud architect? How do agile and DevOps topics work with the cloud? What's the difference between hybrid cloud, multicloud, and polycloud?"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Serverless","timeRequired":"PT4M45S","description":"What are the key serverless technologies that a cloud architect needs to be comfortable implementing?"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Cloud finances","timeRequired":"PT5M42S","description":"Your CFO is focused on the cost implications of cloud migration and the use of the cloud. This video focuses on presenting details about how to talk to your financial team and CFO about the financial impact of using the cloud, and how to architect cloud cost management into your architectural plans."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Cloud security patterns","timeRequired":"PT5M3S","description":"How do you architect an application and its infrastructure to make sure it is secure? How do you build security into your plans and how do you build security monitoring into the application's long-term monitoring processes?"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Cloud-native patterns","timeRequired":"PT4M17S","description":"What does it mean to be cloud-native? What are some of the software architecture patterns and processes that are commonly used in cloud-native applications? Why is being cloud-native important?"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Other cloud patterns","timeRequired":"PT3M19S","description":"When you build an application architecture for the cloud, you have access to patterns, processes, and systems that are unavailable in a typical on-premise infrastructure. What are some of these architectures and how can you take advantage of them?"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Advanced cloud services","timeRequired":"PT2M41S","description":"The cloud has enabled sophisticated use cases that have allowed advanced services to become mainstream. What are some of these advanced services and how can you take advantage of them in your application architectures?"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Cloud architect mindset","timeRequired":"PT2M15S","description":"When you work on a cloud-based application and its infrastructure, you need to have a mindset beyond your current scope of work. You have to shift from thinking about responsible modules to thinking about overall system design and architecture, focusing beyond the code and development tasks and encompassing the customer's needs and an infrastructure‚Äôs capabilities."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Cloud architect certifications","timeRequired":"PT3M12S","description":"Cloud architecture has several certification programs that can provide employers and customers assurances that you understand what it means to architect cloud-based systems. The data attribute works just like any other attribute, but you prefix your custom name with the keyword data as well as a dash. This way you can create your own pieces of data within an HTML tag by putting in your own information with the data hyphen."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Are you comfortable using jQuery?","timeRequired":"PT11M32S","description":"JQuery is one of the most popular JavaScript libraries on the web. In this video, take a look at what it does and why it's so popular."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Describe when you should use the bind() method","timeRequired":"PT5M21S","description":"This week take a look at one of those gotcha pieces of code that you might see in an interview, since it tests your understanding of two important concepts in JavaScript: the this keyword as well as data binding. So that means where it is in your code."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Do you know how to use the conditional operator?","timeRequired":"PT3M43S","description":"The conditional operator is a different version of the regular conditional expression in JavaScript. In this video, explore an example of a conditional operator."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Have you used Ajax to load an external file?","timeRequired":"PT8M25S","description":"Every developer should understand how to make asynchronous requests to a server using Ajax. Once the request is completed, the data is sent back to the browser and your application can do something with that data."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Have you used JavaScript templates?","timeRequired":"PT7M3S","description":"Using JSON and Ajax is great but if you're going to parse more complex data, it's better and more common to use a templating engine. In this video, examine the concept as well as a specific implementation called EJS."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How do you manipulate the DOM?","timeRequired":"PT11M7S","description":"The DOM, or Document Object Model, is one of the most fundamental components of any web application. The DOM is the structure that gives you access to all the content within a website."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How do you search using functional programming?","timeRequired":"PT6M27S","description":"Now, searching through a series of elements can be accomplished in different ways. In this video, learn how to filter through this data and retrieve only the records that match a certain element."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How do you use a constructor to create instances?","timeRequired":"PT10M33S","description":"There's a lot of patterns that developers use in JavaScript, and one of the most common is the constructor pattern. An object uses the power of closures to build reusable elements that remember the environment that they were created in."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How do you use arrow functions in ES6?","timeRequired":"PT6M30S","description":"Arrow functions are one of the new features in JavaScript and a lot of companies are implementing them into day-to-day code. In this video, explore an existing function, part of a click event, that you may want to replace with arrow functions, also called fat arrows."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How do you use the Fetch API?","timeRequired":"PT7M22S","description":"Fetch is the next-generation API for performing Ajax requests. The main difference, besides being much easier to pronounce, is that Fetch uses promises, which makes it easier to set up operations and change sequences of events outside the request."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How do you render JSON to a DOM element?","timeRequired":"PT9M36S","description":"JSON has become a standard for sharing data, especially inside web applications. It's based on JavaScript objects, and very similar to the way you can structure objects within JavaScript, but it's not identical."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How does an IIFE work?","timeRequired":"PT7M12S","description":"An IFFE is a convention in JavaScript that helps you protect variables, as well as execute some code immediately. You have a function declaration and it has no name, so sometimes this is known as an anonymous function."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How does immutability work in JavaScript?","timeRequired":"PT4M12S","description":"Immutability is a pretty important concept and it means that an element is unchangeable. In this video, explore what immutability is not."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How would you use JavaScript reduce()?","timeRequired":"PT3M54S","description":"Reduce is a higher-order function, just like the map method covered in the previous week. So, you probably create something like a variable to hold a running total, and then you create some sort of array to hold the list of elements you want to go through."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Quick concepts: Do you have experience linting your code?","timeRequired":"PT2M31S","description":"Debugging code can be hard enough when you make a logical error, but what gets really frustrating is when the error comes from something much simpler, something like missing punctuation or some other typo. Although you can find several online linters, many are well integrated into code editors or IDEs."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What are event bubbling and propagation about?","timeRequired":"PT11M42S","description":"Events are a huge part of what makes it possible to have dynamic pages so knowing how to work with them and understanding how they work is pretty important. The first is the type of event that you want to track."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What does "use strict" do?","timeRequired":"PT3M28S","description":"Some browsers allow for a feature that runs JavaScript in an alternate version called strict mode."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What is a callback and how do you use it?","timeRequired":"PT8M51S","description":"A callback is a convention in JavaScript that is often used with asynchronous programming. Now because of this, they're used often in events to take care of tasks whenever the events are triggered."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What is the relationship between promises and callbacks?","timeRequired":"PT9M57S","description":"Promises are objects in JavaScript that describe what is supposed to happen when a time-based operation takes place. A callback is nothing more than a function passed as an argument, so this part is what you would refer to as a callback."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What is the virtual DOM?","timeRequired":"PT7M7S","description":"One of the most significant developments in recent history has been the rise of the virtual DOM as the technology that can help speed up development. The DOM is of course the Document Object Model, the conceptual structure that is generated when you create a website."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What is variable hoisting and how do you guard against it?","timeRequired":"PT8M43S","description":"JavaScript can be a tough language to learn, and often during interviews, you are presented with some code and asked to show what the result of that code yield. This is called hoisting because, in essence, it moves the declarations to the top of the relevant scope."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What tooling options have you used in the past?","timeRequired":"PT7M11S","description":"One of the most important skills you should have as a web developer is learning how to set up and work within different environments. Tooling gives you a way to automate common development tasks like minifying code, testing, and running local servers to preview your work while you code."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"When would you use recursion?","timeRequired":"PT6M25S","description":"Recursion is a programming technique that is popular among developers. Now recursion sounds a lot fancier and more complicated than it really is."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Can you build a Sass mixin?","timeRequired":"PT7M57S","description":"In the 2017 State of JavaScript survey, the Sass language outperformed CSS in terms of the number of people who would prefer to use it on a project instead of something like CSS. Sass stands for Syntactically Awesome Style Sheets."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Do you know how to use CSS variables?","timeRequired":"PT10M38S","description":"CSS is an evolving language, and to stand out in an interview, it's good to show that you're keeping up with some of the latest features. The first thing you need to know about this feature is that support is pretty good in most browsers, except for Internet Explorer."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Animate an underline on hover in CSS","timeRequired":"PT9M48S","description":"This week you're going to be taking a look at a question that is a little bit tougher than it seems, because it requires an understanding of a number of different concepts, including modifying the position of an element, transformations, and transitions. So that seems like it should be a pretty simple problem."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Explain the difference between absolute and relative positioning","timeRequired":"PT7M55S","description":"One of the most important properties that page elements can have is the position property. The position property is particularly useful for creating things like tooltips. Take a look at an example of that in this video."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How comfortable are you with Sass?","timeRequired":"PT12M10S","description":"If you're applying for a job today, it's really important that you know how to work with CSS preprocessors, because you'll probably be asked about them during interviews. Sass stands for Syntactically Awesome Style Sheets."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How do you animate CSS?","timeRequired":"PT9M41S","description":"Animation can be one of those tricky questions during an interview because a lot of designers and front-end developers sort of put this off, and it can be a little bit tricky, even though it starts out pretty easily. Now unlike more CSS rules, animation takes place in two parts."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How do you debug CSS using your browser?","timeRequired":"PT10M47S","description":"In a previous interview with John Rivialo, you learned that one of the important skills developers need is the ability to debug their code. Regardless of the tool you're using, it's critical to be comfortable with the developer tools that you know."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How do you use calc() in CSS?","timeRequired":"PT9M56S","description":"Calc is a feature that lets you perform mathematical calculations right in your CSS. The first thing you need to know about calc is that it has fantastic browser support, even down to Internet Explorer 9, and that's great because it means that you can use it today unless you're planning on working with older browsers."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How would you use flexbox to control horizontal alignment?","timeRequired":"PT7M21S","description":"Flexbox is one of the display properties and it makes single-dimensional layouts super easy. Flexbox is one of the available CSS display properties."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"In CSS, what's the difference between ems and rems?","timeRequired":"PT9M58S","description":"CSS has two units of measurements, Ems and Rems, that have become really popular because of their flexibility, especially when working with fonts. But in some older versions of IE, they are not resizable, and that presents an accessibility issue if someone doesn't have good eyesight, and needs to make sure that the fonts are bigger on your page."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What's the difference between a pseudo-class and a pseudo-element?","timeRequired":"PT6M16S","description":"This week, learn about the difference between pseudo-classes versus pseudo-elements. This is a question that you may get in some interviews. A pseudo-class is a way of selecting an existing HTML element."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Do you know how to use npm?","timeRequired":"PT8M40S","description":"If you're a developer applying for a job today, there is one key piece of tooling software that you're going to need to know, and that's npm, the Node package manager. Npm allows you to create or use a variety of packages available to developers on the web."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Do you have experience using version control?","timeRequired":"PT16M37S","description":"Version control allows you to manage changes to projects by saving the state of code at different times."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How does routing work in a modern web application?","timeRequired":"PT9M30S","description":"Modern web applications can often communicate with the server and have more direct access to both the request that is being sent to the server as well as the response that you get back from the server. One of the things to remember about routes is that any application that can manage routing uses the URI or uniform resource identifier, sometimes known as the URL for uniform resource locator to communicate and send requests to the server."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Create a list of URLs from these links","timeRequired":"PT7M16S","description":"Sometimes the questions you get during an interview are designed to test not how you would do something, but why you would do it a certain way. In this video, take a look at a definition and then take some time for coding practice."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Show me how to use the map function","timeRequired":"PT5M7S","description":"Moving through lists of elements is a fundamental task in just about any programming job. In this video, learn what psychological safety is, why it matters, and how to model it on your team."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"A knowledge-sharing culture","timeRequired":"PT3M15S","description":"Knowledge sharing is critical to breaking down silos, onboarding new team members, and helping existing team members grow. In this video, learn effective strategies for fostering a knowledge-sharing culture on your team to help you and your teammates thrive."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Building trust","timeRequired":"PT2M56S","description":"Trust forms the foundation that allows great engineering teams to execute at a high level. In this video, learn how to build trusting and meaningful relationships with your teammates and achieve greater autonomy."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Giving and receiving feedback","timeRequired":"PT3M11S","description":"Giving and receiving feedback fosters a culture of continuous improvement and encourages a growth mindset. In this video, learn how to effectively share timely feedback and use constructive feedback to further your development."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Challenge: Are you a true team player?","timeRequired":"PT43S","description":"In this challenge video, specify examples of how you've contributed to promoting psychological safety, trust, and feedback on your teams."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Solution: Are you a true team player?","timeRequired":"PT53S","description":"In this solution video, explore additional resources about psychological safety, building trust, and giving and receiving feedback to help you commit to becoming a better teammate."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Why EQ is a critical skill?","timeRequired":"PT2M17S","description":"Studies show that EQ is a stronger predictor of career success for software engineers than IQ. In this video, learn what EQ is and why it differentiates an average software engineer from a great one."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Handling conflict effectively","timeRequired":"PT2M18S","description":"Interpersonal conflicts are common on software development teams, especially in high-stress environments. In this video, learn approaches for handling conflict situations through effective communication and empathy."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Coping with stress and burnout","timeRequired":"PT3M3S","description":"Emotional intelligence and the ability to self-regulate are linked to reduced stress levels. In this video, learn how to develop self-awareness and regulation in order to demonstrate resilience and handle the intense pressures and deadlines of software projects."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Demonstrating empathy","timeRequired":"PT2M24S","description":"Demonstrating empathy helps you build great software for your users and be a true team player. In this video, learn how empathy helps you understand requirements, write better code, and build stronger relationships with your team."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Overcoming self-doubt","timeRequired":"PT3M8S","description":"Negative thought patterns and imposter syndrome can hold you back from achieving your full potential as a software engineer. In this video, learn about anti-patterns and how to use best practices for overcoming self-doubt."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Challenge: Developing your EQ skills","timeRequired":"PT45S","description":"In this challenge video, identify the EQ skills you'd most like to improve on and why. Based on your selected growth areas, explore additional resources to enhance your learning."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Communicate proactively","timeRequired":"PT2M56S","description":"As a software engineer, it's important to be a proactive communicator and keep your team informed of challenges or delays that could impact your ability to deliver results. Learn the top mistakes that you should avoid as a data scientist.","duration":"PT21S","datePublished":"2020-10-19","uploadDate":"2020-10-19","requiresSubscription":true,"isAccessibleForFree":false,"contentUrl":"https://www.linkedin.com/learning/15-mistakes-to-avoid-in-data-science/get-started-on-the-right-path"}]],"syllabusSections":[{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Avoid common mistakes to excel in data science","timeRequired":"PT30S"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Communicating with overly technical language","timeRequired":"PT1M","description":"Data science is a highly technical field, which can alienate the non-data-savvy. In this video, learn how using overly technical language can negatively impact your data science projects."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Skipping the fundamentals","timeRequired":"PT1M5S","description":"It's unavoidable to encounter repetitive simple tasks when working with data, but it's important to be incredibly thorough despite the repetition. In this video, learn how to recognize the importance of cleaning your data and starting with the basics before beginning an analysis."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Moving too quickly","timeRequired":"PT56S","description":"It's easy to get excited when working with novel data sets or chasing after unique problems. In this video, learn how to analyze whether you're moving too fast on a project and determine when it's right to slow down."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Having a data set that is too small","timeRequired":"PT1M","description":"If you overlook the size of your data set, you may run into serious problems later. In this video, learn about the types of complications that arise from small data sets."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Failing to adopt new tools","timeRequired":"PT1M16S","description":"Oftentimes, the best analysis is dependent upon using the best tool or the most current algorithm. In this video, learn how new tools are perceived and used by data scientists."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Not considering the level of variation","timeRequired":"PT1M20S","description":"Variation is a really important data science project and is often poorly communicated to stakeholders. In this video, learn how variation impacts results in data analysis projects."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Lack of documentation","timeRequired":"PT1M30S","description":"Documentation must be at the core of every data science workflow. In this video, learn why documentation is important and why it should be included in your workflow."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Relying solely on formal education","timeRequired":"PT1M22S","description":"A formal degree or certification program is a great foundation but it doesn't keep current on its own. In this video, learn how to identify why practical education is so important and the need to always be learning."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Taking too long to share results","timeRequired":"PT1M10S","description":"Most data projects are time-sensitive and it's always necessary to maintain the right balance. In this video, learn why data analysis projects can be time-sensitive and how to know when you're taking too long."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Including your bias","timeRequired":"PT1M1S","description":"When working with data sets it's easy to inadvertently introduce persona bias into the analysis. In this video, learn how bias impacts outcomes in data analysis."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Overpromising solutions to stakeholders","timeRequired":"PT1M4S","description":"Setting expectations appropriately is a necessary skill for every data scientist. In this video, learn about problems that arise when overpromising to stakeholders."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Building tools from scratch","timeRequired":"PT1M","description":"Writing code is a key skill for a data scientist but it is tedious work. In this video, learn how to identify the tools you already have access to so you can avoid having to write code from scratch."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Assuming the knowledge level of stakeholders","timeRequired":"PT41S","description":"Presenting data without matching the language to the knowledge level of the room is a common mistake. In this video, learn how to simplify your language when working with stakeholders."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Not telling a story with the data","timeRequired":"PT1M53S","description":"Data is only helpful for achieving goals if it's well understood. In this video, learn how to recognize the importance of looking beyond the data and how to make sure every data set tells a compelling story."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Not confirming with stakeholders","timeRequired":"PT1M57S","description":"A common mistake in data science is making assumptions about the goals of a project. In this video, learn how to develop an approach for confirming desired outcomes on data projects with all stakeholders."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Get started on the right path","timeRequired":"PT21S"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":331,"ratingValue":4.5,"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},"review":[{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Sanjeev Mishra","jobTitle":"Deputy Manager Nuvoco Vistas Corp. You can tag your instructor Kate Strachnyi in your post so she can engage with your content."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Engaging with others","timeRequired":"PT2M57S","description":"In this video, learn how to engage with other people's content to grow your own brand. It is about understanding how new technologies like Web 3.0 are going to impact your business and creating a holistic strategy to build those skills in your team to empower them to deliver on key business objectives."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Understanding business priorities and KPIs","timeRequired":"PT1M36S","description":"Organizations today realize that people are their biggest asset and they need to invest in people to be able to grow. But before you as a tech leader create a strategy to invest in your team, you need to have a clear understanding of the business priorities and the key performance indicators. After viewing this video, you will be able to review your business priorities and measurement criteria and understand what role your team will play in achieving them."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Evaluating the shift in business priorities","timeRequired":"PT1M16S","description":"Every organization goes through extensive strategy sessions every year to identify business priorities. In uncertain times, a company might decide to shift its business priority to address a crisis midway through the year. The teams and goals for the teams are based on these business priorities. After viewing this video, you will be able to review your current business priorities against the new priorities being proposed and evaluate what it means for your team."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Identifying the team you need to execute on the priorities","timeRequired":"PT1M","description":"When business priorities change, what is expected from teams changes too. After viewing this video, you will be able to chart out the ideal team you need to deliver on your goals."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Identifying the skills you need","timeRequired":"PT2M15S","description":"While many times, leaders start with \"who\" they need on the team, it is important to understand what skills are required in each role. After viewing this video, you will be able to use a defined process to identify technical and non-technical skills that you need on your team."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Identifying the skillset of your current team","timeRequired":"PT1M17S","description":"Most organizations like a skill inventory at the employee level. After viewing this video, you will be able to map your team's existing skillset using tools like use tools like self-assessment surveys or skill tests, or certifications acquired."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Identifying the skills gap","timeRequired":"PT1M4S","description":"While identifying the skill gap, it is important to go a level deeper and identify the skill-level gap as well. After viewing this video, you will be able to compare the required skills with the current skill level of each team member to identify areas where there are gaps."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Creating a strategy to address the skills gap","timeRequired":"PT1M50S","description":"You can address the skills gap in your team either by upskilling your team members, reskilling them, or hiring new team members. After viewing this video, you will be able to create a strategy to address the skills gap in your team to meet your goals."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Doing a cost-benefit analysis","timeRequired":"PT1M45S","description":"Upskilling and reskilling your team involves time and effort. So there is a cost associated with it. When you create the strategy to address the skill gap, you should take into account how much will it cost you to bridge the skills gap in your existing team vs. hiring someone who already has those skills. After viewing this video, you will be able to do a cost-benefit analysis using the criteria shared in the video."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Building projections for team growth","timeRequired":"PT1M1S","description":"Upskilling is not a one-time effort. As you create the strategy to address the skills gap, you need to consider how your team's charter will evolve over time and how you plan for continuous learning so that your team is ready. After viewing this video, you will have an understanding of how to project the skills you will need for your team in the future."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Getting stakeholder buy-in","timeRequired":"PT1M20S","description":"Once you have the skiing strategy in place, you will need to get buy-in from the stakeholders like your functional leader on budget, the L&D leader on building out the learning programs, and potentially a system to track the skills acquired by the team and report on the progress of bridging the skills gap. After viewing this video, you will be able to craft a message on how to get stakeholder buy-in."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Providing training opportunities","timeRequired":"PT1M38S","description":"There are two key aspects of building skills- knowledge and applicability. Leverage training through LinkedIn Learning to build knowledge. After viewing this video, you will be able to work with your L&D team to create training opportunities for your team."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Providing mentoring and coaching","timeRequired":"PT1M40S","description":"While on-demand self-paced courses provide knowledge, coaching, and mentoring provide context and enable your team members to apply that knowledge with confidence in their everyday job. After viewing this video, you will be familiar with key considerations for designing coaching opportunities. In addition, you will be able to work with your L&D partner to create a coaching and mentoring framework to upskill your team."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Providing cross-functional training opportunities","timeRequired":"PT2M9S","description":"Every organization is unique and there are various internal systems and processes that an individual needs to understand before they can be productive in their role. If your addressing tech skills gap strategy involves leveraging team members from adjacent teams, you need to build a cross-functional training process so that the team members understand team-specific processes. After viewing this video, you will be able to build a framework for cross-functional training."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Identifying adjacent departments to tap into","timeRequired":"PT1M35S","description":"Even if you have great team members who are eager to upskill and perform in the new role, you might need them in their current role and need an additional headcount to jump in and hit the ground running. In such cases, you can tap into adjacent departments to fill the skills gap. After viewing this video, you will be able to identify the adjacent departments from where you can hire internally to fill the skills gap."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Looking for transferable skills","timeRequired":"PT1M44S","description":"While considering internal moves, it is important to not get stuck with an individual's current role, title, or team. It is important to consider transferable skills that will bring value to your team and help you address the skills gap. After viewing this video, you will be able to evaluate internal candidates based on their transferable skills."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Building equitable hiring criteria","timeRequired":"PT1M57S","description":"As a leader, as you open upskilling and reskilling opportunities in your team, you have to make sure that there is equity in the process. After viewing this video, you will be familiar with key considerations like access to training, mentors, and clear communication on skill levels that will help you bring equity while upskilling your team."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Creating equitable goals and measurement criteria","timeRequired":"PT1M10S","description":"When you decide to upskill certain team members in your team to address the skills gap, it is important to make sure that the goals and measurement criteria are equitable. After viewing this video, you will be able to evaluate various options to create unbiased goals and measurement criteria."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Next steps","timeRequired":"PT33S","description":"In today's world, as a tech leader, you have to always keep a close eye on advancements in technology and make sure that you are continuously upskilling your team to bridge the skills gap. After viewing this video, the next steps will be to use the templates provided in this course to start building out the upskilling strategy for your team."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":79,"ratingValue":4.8,"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},"review":[{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Austine  Chibuike Uzoma","jobTitle":"AUSTINE","url":"https://ca.linkedin.com/in/austine-chibuike-uzoma-2172a7217"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":5},"reviewBody":"yes very interesting ","datePublished":"2024-05-14T00:33:54.595Z","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"LinkedIn"},"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Jarque Eilers","jobTitle":"Competence Development","url":"https://za.linkedin.com/in/jarque-eilers-952361109"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":5},"reviewBody":"This is an intuitive learning about tech skills gap, to stay focus when market trend increase.","datePublished":"2024-04-22T19:05:18.262Z","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"LinkedIn"},"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"john schmitz","jobTitle":"--","url":"https://au.linkedin.com/in/john-schmitz-6b7790218"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":5},"reviewBody":"great course","datePublished":"2024-01-06T09:15:13.343Z","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"LinkedIn"},"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1}],"video":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Preparing for growth - In this video, learn how to take some of that pressure away by being well prepared beforehand."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Getting experience without experience","timeRequired":"PT1M45S","description":"Experience can be found in various places, including your previous or current jobs. In this video, learn how to recognize that experience and highlight it to future employers."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Certifications","timeRequired":"PT3M10S","description":"Certifications in software testing can be a good benefit when applying for a testing job but shouldn't be a barrier for you to apply. In this video, learn an overview of the certifications and how to approach not having one in an interview."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Researching the opportunity","timeRequired":"PT1M57S","description":"A little bit of research into a role can mean the difference between an impressive interview and a bad one. In this video, learn how to perform research into the role available and the company to gather questions for your interview panel."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Test automation","timeRequired":"PT1M47S","description":"Test automation skills are a great benefit to have when going into a testing interview, maybe you have them and maybe you don't. In this video, learn how to handle each situation accordingly with your interview panel."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Exploratory testing","timeRequired":"PT2M2S","description":"Some exploratory testing experience can really help to impress interviewers. In this video, learn how to highlight formal and informal exploratory testing in your interview."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Integration testing","timeRequired":"PT1M56S","description":"Integration testing experience can really show off the depth of your software testing skills. In this video, learn how to showcase this experience even if you don't think you have it."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"API testing","timeRequired":"PT1M57S","description":"An API is the layer of a system just beneath the GUI you normally interact with. Knowledge of this can really impress interviewers. In this video, learn how to advocate API testing and highlight your experience with it."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"UX testing","timeRequired":"PT1M45S","description":"UX testing is where testers look at the overall user experience rather than functionality. In this video, learn why that's important and how to impress interviewers by becoming a good evangelist for this style of testing."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Challenge: Bug reporting","timeRequired":"PT1M7S","description":"In this challenge, you are asked to write what you think should be included within a bug report that is then be seen by a development engineer for fixing. You are given a certain amount of time to think of answers before being shown the answers in the next video."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Solution: Bug reporting","timeRequired":"PT2M","description":"In this video, learn the answers from the previous challenge and the important aspects of a bug report."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"SQL and database","timeRequired":"PT2M6S","description":"Skills in database manipulation can help put your job application above others. In this video, learn how to highlight those skills and showcase them to interviewers."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Cloud technology","timeRequired":"PT2M11S","description":"Experience using cloud technologies can really impress interviewers. In this video, learn how to show off your cloud skills when it comes to software testing."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"CLI use","timeRequired":"PT1M42S","description":"The CLI can be a  powerful tool for any engineer within the software and a great skill to have. In this video, learn how to promote your CLI skills for software testing."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Scripting","timeRequired":"PT1M41S","description":"The ability to create scripts to aid your work can impress almost any interview panel. In this video, learn how simple scripts can go a long way with your interview."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Challenge: Test planning","timeRequired":"PT54S","description":"Sometimes software testing interviews can include a whiteboard demonstration. In this video, explore an example registration. In this challenge, you are given a period of time to plan out some tests for it."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Solution: Test planning","timeRequired":"PT2M36S","description":"In this video, explore a number of answers from the previous challenge."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Estimation","timeRequired":"PT1M59S","description":"In test planning, the skill of estimation can be a useful one to have and to highlight to potential employers. In this video, learn how to document your previous estimation experience."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"SDLC and Agile","timeRequired":"PT1M37S","description":"An understanding of the application lifecycle of a company can show forethought and preparation for an interview. In this video, learn how to share your knowledge of working practices and to ask about the companies."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Teamwork","timeRequired":"PT1M43S","description":"Teamwork is a important aspect of software testing and highlighting this within an interview can be a great benefit to you.
