In this video, learn how managers can start approaching this challenge."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"My journey with inclusion","timeRequired":"PT3M30S","description":"Many managers have a moment when they feel lost on how to handle inclusivity, and other moments when they feel like they are making progress. In this video, hear a personal story to help explain these situations."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Introverts and extroverts","timeRequired":"PT4M11S","description":"Introverts often communicate differently from other more boisterous colleagues. In this video, learn how managers can build a team with diverse communication styles."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Silent performers","timeRequired":"PT3M18S","description":"Many teams have high performers who maintain a low profile. In this video, learn how managers can set up such employees for success in promotions and high-profile opportunities."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Inclusivity and identity","timeRequired":"PT3M31S","description":"Identity is about how employees relate to their job, present themselves at work, or identify themselves. Managers have a role in making them feel welcome and included."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Inclusivity and networking","timeRequired":"PT3M54S","description":"Employees are often given opportunities based on their relationships, and this often hurts some other employees. In this video, learn how managers can build a team for diverse kinds of networking and aspire for equal opportunity."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Education vs. experience","timeRequired":"PT3M54S","description":"Different kinds of educational backgrounds offer different perspectives, yet sometimes employees with prestigious degrees get preference. In this video, learn how managers can avoid such biases creeping into their team."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Industry experience","timeRequired":"PT3M56S","description":"Employees who follow uncharacteristic career paths tend to face resistance during project assignments and leadership initiatives. In this video, learn how managers can make diverse work histories a strength for individuals and the team."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Across the age divides","timeRequired":"PT2M21S","description":"Ageism is not just a phenomenon in hiring, but in how people are given opportunities and included in high-visibility projects and conversations. In this video, learn how managers can avoid these biases and leverage experienced workers more effectively."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Building a sense of belonging","timeRequired":"PT2M41S","description":"Inclusivity is not just about including everyone but making everyone feel included. In this video, learn how managers can make this a team effort and a part of team culture."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Strategies for feedback","timeRequired":"PT2M23S","description":"Inclusivity requires allowing people to make mistakes and giving them feedback so that they can learn in a trust-based environment. In this video, learn how managers can set a tone of learning and trust to foster inclusivity."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Mentoring and career building","timeRequired":"PT1M47S","description":"Managers have to be available as mentors to their team since having supportive leadership helps employees feel included. In this video, learn how managers can get started as mentors."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Next steps for your inclusive team","timeRequired":"PT1M27S","description":"After completing this course, explore specific suggestions and action items to help drive inclusivity and make your teams fairer, happier, and therefore more productive."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":70,"ratingValue":4.7,"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},"review":[{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"R Srinivasu","jobTitle":"General Manager, State Bank of India","url":"https://mu.linkedin.com/in/r-srinivasu-2a581854"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":4},"reviewBody":"good","datePublished":"2024-09-02T10:25:18.357Z","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"LinkedIn"},"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Srinivasu  Panangipalli ","jobTitle":"Deputy General Manager, State Bank of India","url":"https://in.linkedin.com/in/srinivasu-panangipalli-3bba69a9"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":5},"reviewBody":"good","datePublished":"2024-08-26T10:23:34.618Z","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"LinkedIn"},"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Caragh O'Buachalla","jobTitle":"TU Dublin Student Hub Operations Manager","url":"https://ie.linkedin.com/in/caragh-o-buachalla-bb284413"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":5},"reviewBody":"Very engaging, nice pace","datePublished":"2023-11-06T18:33:28.192Z","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"LinkedIn"},"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1}],"video":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Transform careers with inclusivity - Inclusive Tech: Building Your Team","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Nishant Bhajaria","description":"Author of \"Data Privacy: A Runbook for Engineers\". In this video, learn how to identify ways to prepare for a new leadership role."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Understanding your team","timeRequired":"PT2M43S","description":"When you start leading a team, it is important to understand the skillset you have on your team and the skill set needed in the team to achieve the goals. In this video, learn how to identify the skills you need on your team."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Hiring for complementary skills","timeRequired":"PT3M46S","description":"When building your team, you need to hire people with complementary skills rather than people with the same skillset. In this video, learn how to identify the skillset you need on your team and hire right."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Always be hiring","timeRequired":"PT3M19S","description":"Hiring good people takes time. It's not just about their skillset, but also about cultural fit. In this video, learn how to use avenues like LinkedIn, conferences, and your professional network to have a pool of identified potential team members."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Communicating organizational vision","timeRequired":"PT3M52S","description":"Organizations are successful only when all teams within an organization can relate and align with the vision. In this video, learn how to effectively communicate the organization vision to your team."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Creating the goal for your team","timeRequired":"PT2M50S","description":"Learn how to create team goals that align with the organizational vision, across tech and non-tech teams. Setting goals aren't just a guiding principle, it is a critical step toward achieving progress and moving a team forward."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Creating KPIs for the common goal","timeRequired":"PT3M39S","description":"A goal is meaningful when it resonates with the entire team and when the team knows that the projects they are working on contributing to the goal. In this video, learn how to create KPI's for your tech and non-tech team that aligns with the common goal."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Integrating your team with the business","timeRequired":"PT1M51S","description":"In an organization, it is important that engineering and business teams communicate effectively. For a business to be successful, it is important that the product and its business value are in harmony. In this video, discover why you need to deliver your message effectively to both tech and non-tech audience."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Talking tech to a non-tech audience","timeRequired":"PT2M38S","description":"As leaders, it is important to be able to communicate technical concepts and information to business leaders and non-tech audience. In this video, learn how to effectively communicate technical concepts and integrate your team with the business."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Talking business to a tech audience","timeRequired":"PT2M1S","description":"Many engineering and tech teams think that they already‚Äîor worse, don't need to‚Äîunderstand how the business and strategy work. As a leader, it is important to effectively communicate business concepts and decisions to your tech teams. In this video, be ready to implement best practices for effectively communicating key business concepts and decisions."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Leading a global team","timeRequired":"PT2M35S","description":"Most leaders struggle to create a shared vision and align global teams even after a successful track record in high-level domestic leadership positions. In this video, learn the importance of aligning your global team."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Communicating across cultures","timeRequired":"PT3M43S","description":"While global teams bring various benefits, there are also unique challenges, such as time-zone and cultural differences. In this video, learn about some ways in which you can effectively communicate and make sure that teams are aligned and motivated immaterial of the geographical location."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Implementing a global vision","timeRequired":"PT3M12S","description":"Establishing a shared vision along with clear goals and objectives for a global team is important given the geographical distance and cultural nuances. In this video, learn how to ensure that all teams understand the vision and are passionate about it."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Working with global teams","timeRequired":"PT2M47S","description":"Most companies are now geographically dispersed to succeed in the global economy. But the global presence brings its own set of challenges, one of them being fostering teamwork in a geographically dispersed team. The HQ versus regional offices tension is real! In this video, learn how to learn some ways in which you can foster a culture of teamwork in global teams."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Next steps","timeRequired":"PT35S"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1959,"ratingValue":4.8,"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},"review":[{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Ashish Garg","jobTitle":"MBCS, IT Service Architect","url":"https://uk.linkedin.com/in/gargashish74"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":5},"reviewBody":"Content of the course and delivery of the course is very effective.","datePublished":"2024-10-01T15:50:17.553Z","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"LinkedIn"},"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Chikae Satoh","jobTitle":"Leasing Coordinator","url":"https://www.linkedin.com/in/chikae-satoh-9a9961b"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":5},"reviewBody":"It gave me a clear idea of what was expected as a first-time tech manager","datePublished":"2024-09-27T18:02:21.916Z","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"LinkedIn"},"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Dr.Meseret Amanuel","jobTitle":"GP at NTE/JTI Ethiopia","url":"https://et.linkedin.com/in/dr-meseret-amanuel-7894b5178"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":4},"reviewBody":"The teaching is most relevant, Yes I will share it with others.","datePublished":"2024-09-24T13:25:30.590Z","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"LinkedIn"},"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1}],"video":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"What it takes to lead - Knowing this will enable learners to implement the right tools to close organization pay gaps."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Why does the pay gap matter?","timeRequired":"PT2M15S","description":"In this video, learn why closing the pay gap will benefit the tech sector and how you can utilize your professional role to do this."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"The risks of standing still","timeRequired":"PT3M","description":"This video gives clear examples of the risks of not prioritizing closing pay gaps to the tech sector. Having examples of the impact in organizations where closing the pay gap was not a priority will enable learners to feel more confident in taking actions to close pay gaps."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Holding brave conversations","timeRequired":"PT4M27S","description":"In this video, learn why preparing for and learning how to hold professional conversations will benefit your organization. This video shares data on the positive impact that open pay conversations in the workplace can have."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Why pay transparency matters","timeRequired":"PT5M21S","description":"This video discusses what pay transparency is and why it's important to encourage in the tech sector. It gives clear examples of how this can be done that learners can take away and implement in their organization."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Pay gap closing in action","timeRequired":"PT3M6S","description":"In this video, learn how to map out a range of goals you can implement in your organization to close pay gaps. Having a range of goals to close pay gaps will boost organization morale and belief in prioritizing this."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Recruitment: Affinity bias","timeRequired":"PT3M59S","description":"In this video, learn what you can do to minimize pay gaps in your organization's recruitment processes. Focusing on the recruitment process will enable hiring managers to effectively address pay gap issues at the start of a new employee's career within the organization."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Recruitment: Women paying the price","timeRequired":"PT3M8S","description":"This video discusses the impact of biases that women face when negotiating in the workplace. This equips learners with the skills to identify where potential bias can creep in and know how to mitigate these in future negotiations."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Reward: Breaking pay secrecy","timeRequired":"PT4M56S","description":"This video looks at how pay secrecy contributes to organizational and sector pay gaps. This helps learners critically examine their organizational pay structures and understand what changes regarding pay conversations need to happen."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Reward: Why culture fit is a promotion hurdle","timeRequired":"PT2M50S","description":"This video examines how past actions that involved hiring and retaining for culture fit have contributed to the pay gap. The concept of culture fit is often used as a crutch when it comes to retaining, hiring, and promoting on a tech team. This video exposes that catch-all phrase, discusses how it can impact a hiring manger's decisions, and equips individual contributors with the language needed to address the issue."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Retention: Benefits in disguise","timeRequired":"PT3M22S","description":"In this video, learn about how the pay gap can be exacerbated by the \"long hours\" working culture and presenteeism. Focusing on the working culture can help learners effectively assess and determine what behaviors and cultural norms are contributing to pay gaps."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Retention: Now is the time of culture add","timeRequired":"PT3M8S","description":"Begin to map how you can recruit and retain for culture add while closing the pay gap. This video discusses how focusing on building inclusivity in your workplace culture will improve attraction and retention rates."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What is the gender pay gap costing you?","timeRequired":"PT2M7S","description":"This video examines the global and sector cost of the gender pay gap. Having a clearer idea of the financial cost of pay gaps can motivate individual hiring managers to play their part in prioritizing closing those gaps."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Millennials, Gen Z, and the gender pay gap","timeRequired":"PT3M17S","description":"In this video, learn why this issue is an important economic and social justice issue for the millennial workforce. Understanding how important this is to millennials enables organizations to ensure that they stay both culturally relevant and financially viable as more and more millennials enter the workforce."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Pay transparency: A big idea to change the world","timeRequired":"PT2M57S","description":"In this video, learn how and why pay transparency fits within your organization's wider DEI strategy. Pay transparency is increasingly becoming a priority issue and can support existing DEI initiatives if implemented effectively."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How to implement pay transparency in your organization","timeRequired":"PT3M11S","description":"This video looks at what the UK, US, Indian, and Australian governments are doing to close the pay gap. Explore examples of initiatives to close pay gaps globally to think about what you could do in your organization."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Closing the pay gap","timeRequired":"PT1M3S","description":"It's time to take the skills you've learned and apply them to closing the pay gap in your organization. Michelle Gyimah offers encouragement to do so."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":40,"ratingValue":4.8,"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},"review":[{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Tanya Lau","jobTitle":"Learning experience design | People focused Technology-Systems-Data through Human Centred Design","url":"https://au.linkedin.com/in/tanyalau"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":4},"reviewBody":"Complex issues explained simply and clearly, excellent examples to illustrate how bias plays out in the tech sector as well as more broadly across a range of sectors, and actionable steps to address it both as a prospective employee and employer. In this video, you are introduced to some of the common misconceptions about technical interviews and learn how to stand out as an interview candidate."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Understand types of interview questions","timeRequired":"PT2M14S","description":"Learn about the different types of questions you might get in a Java interview as well as how they might vary so that you can be prepared for any interview situation."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Get ready for your technical interview","timeRequired":"PT1M3S","description":"Learn how to prepare for technical interviews, even if you're not looking for a new job. In this video, learn how to prepare yourself for any interview opportunity that comes your way."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How to use CoderPad","timeRequired":"PT2M28S","description":"This video guides you through how to use the CoderPad tool."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What's the Java Virtual Machine?","timeRequired":"PT2M21S","description":"Java runs on the Java Virtual Machine, which allows Java to be flexible and run on almost any platform. This core component is often asked about in Java technical interviews. In this video, discover what it is and how it relates to your Java code."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What's the JDK and JRE?","timeRequired":"PT2M14S","description":"The Java Runtime Environment (JRE) allows you to run your program while the Java Development Kit (JDK) contains everything the JRE has plus tools to develop Java programs. These are essential components used behind the scenes to develop and run Java programs and are often asked about in Java technical interviews. In this video, explore the differences between the JDK and JRE and in which scenarios each is required."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What are classes, instances, and constructors?","timeRequired":"PT2M59S","description":"Nearly every object in real life can be represented in code with classes and instances of these classes can be created with constructors. In your programming interview, you may be asked a question about one of these topics or asked to create a small program using these concepts. In this video, review how to use classes, instances, and constructors to represent data in your code."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What's the difference between static and non-static methods?","timeRequired":"PT6M55S","description":"The difference between static and non-static methods is often asked in Java interviews because it is a concise way to see how familiar an interviewee is with adding functionality to classes and using that functionality with instances and inside other functions. In this video, review the differences between static and non-static methods as well as which coding scenarios each are useful for."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How is scope used in Java?","timeRequired":"PT2M23S","description":"Depending on the programming language you are working in, the definition of scope can vary. In this video, review how scope works in Java to ensure the variables and methods written in your whiteboard coding solutions are correct."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How do you access modifiers restrict scope?","timeRequired":"PT2M44S","description":"Learn how you can use different access modifiers to restrict the scope of specific functionality in Java. Access modifiers are often asked about in Java interviews because they can help make your programs more secure and maintainable. In this video, learn how to use various variable and method access modifiers to assign where different members are visible in your program."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Understand the impact of Jigsaw","timeRequired":"PT2M40S","description":"In Java 9, Jigsaw introduced a new modular system for using components of the JDK in your Java applications. Your interviewer may ask you about Jigsaw so it's important to understand how it can help you improve your application's performance and scale down your application for smaller devices."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Use optionals to avoid NullPointerExceptions","timeRequired":"PT3M26S","description":"Introduced in Java 8, Optionals are commonly used in Enterprise Java code. Optionals can be a great tool to use for avoiding NullPointerExceptions and errors in your whiteboard technical interview solutions."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Create Lambdas to pass functionality as data","timeRequired":"PT5M14S","description":"Lambdas introduce some functional programming support in Java that allows you to pass functions as data. These can be useful in your whiteboard solutions if you want to create a function with an interface without assigning it to a class."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Use the Streams API to process collections","timeRequired":"PT3M57S","description":"Instead of using for loops to iterate through your lists, the Streams API allows you to collapse your iteration into a more concise, readable code. It can be a great tool to use in your whiteboard coding interview solutions."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Discuss the pros and cons of local variable type inference","timeRequired":"PT2M42S","description":"Introduced in Java 10, local variable type inference can help collapse some long class names in declaring variables in your code. The use of local variable type inference is debated among Java developers so your interviewer may ask for your opinion on the new feature."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Leverage new switch expressions","timeRequired":"PT3M36S","description":"In Java 12 and 14, new switch expressions are introduced that allow you to set a value directly to a variable. Using these in your whiteboard solutions when applicable can show you are proficient and up to date with the Java language."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Concatenate strings with different methods","timeRequired":"PT3M20S","description":"Review the different ways you can concatenate strings with the concatenation operator, concat method, StringBuilder, and the StringBuffer. In a technical interview, you often need to concatenate strings so it's important to understand the advantages and disadvantages of each method."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Normalize string input","timeRequired":"PT4M13S","description":"Review the different ways you can manipulate individual strings with string methods. Depending on the technical interview question, these string methods are great for normalizing your string input so that you can grab the necessary data from the string."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Access data from strings","timeRequired":"PT4M44S","description":"Review the different ways you can access data from individual strings using built-in string functionality. Depending on the technical interview question, these string methods can be great tools for efficiently accessing necessary data."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Apply string functions in technical interviews","timeRequired":"PT4M35S","description":"Sometimes you may need to use more advanced string functions on more complex string data. In this video, review how to use more advanced string methods, such as split to manipulate strings."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Understand string equality","timeRequired":"PT4M2S","description":"Review the two different ways you can create strings in Java and how that can affect the way they are stored and referenced in memory. In your whiteboard coding interview, you may have to compute whether two strings are equal and it's important you choose the correct comparison operator for your algorithm."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Solution: Developing a Palindrome Checker","timeRequired":"PT3M49S","description":"Learn how to write a program that checks if a string is a palindrome. Walk through two potential solutions to this technical interview problem."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Solution: Counting with String Manipulation","timeRequired":"PT2M40S","description":"Learn how to create an algorithm that solves a technical interview question about string manipulation. Walk through two potential solutions to this coding problem."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Review arrays for technical interviews","timeRequired":"PT6M7S","description":"Review the concept of an array and how to use arrays in Java. Arrays are a useful data structure to use in answering whiteboard coding interviews because, with an array, you easily can sort and retrieve your data by index."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Solution: Maximum Product of Two Numbers","timeRequired":"PT6M51S","description":"Learn how to use indices to find the maximum product of two numbers in an unsorted array. Walk through a few different solutions using arrays, as well as common algorithm strategies that can help you during your technical interview."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Mastering linked lists for whiteboard coding interviews","timeRequired":"PT7M1S","description":"Review the advantages and disadvantages of the linked list data structure as well as how to use linked lists in Java. Depending on the technical interview question, you may want to organize your data in a linked list so you can easily modify and retrieve your data in a sequential manner."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Solution: Delete the Middle of a Linked List","timeRequired":"PT1M4S","description":"Learn how to use slow and fast pointers to delete the middle node of a singly-linked list in Java. Using slow and fast pointers with linked lists is a common strategy for solving linked list whiteboard coding questions."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Leveraging stacks as a data structure","timeRequired":"PT4M36S","description":"Review the definition of a stack as well as how you can create and traverse stacks in Java. Understanding the different use cases where you can use a stack to manage your data can help you decipher the right coding scenarios and technical interview solutions to use it in."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Using queues in technical interviews","timeRequired":"PT4M5S","description":"Review the queue data structure and how queues are represented in Java. Understanding how to use this data structure along with its advantages and disadvantages can help you determine if queues are helpful for your solution to a given technical interview problem."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Mastering hash-based structures","timeRequired":"PT4M51S","description":"HashMaps, HashSets, and Hashtables are the most commonly used data structures in technical interviews. Review the hash-based data structures that exist in Java as well as the underlying technology that makes hashing possible. Discover the coding scenarios where using a hash-based data structure is most beneficial."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Solution: Generate Binary Numbers","timeRequired":"PT5M15S","description":"Learn how to leverage the queue data structure to create a program that generates a given amount of binary numbers. Walk through a solution that reads and writes data to a queue in order to determine the next binary number to generate and print to the user."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Solution: Matching Parentheses","timeRequired":"PT4M","description":"Learn how to use a stack in Java to determine if a piece of text has matching parentheses. Using stacks to keep track of state data can be a useful strategy in technical interviews."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Solution: Find Most Repeated Word","timeRequired":"PT3M46S","description":"Learn how to use various hash-based data structures in Java to create a program that finds the most repeated word in a given piece of text. This technical interview question can be asked in many different forms, such as asking for the most repeated character or most repeated phrase contained in a piece of data, but the strategies involved in the solutions to all of these problems are very similar."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Mastering abstraction for technical interviews","timeRequired":"PT6M45S","description":"Master abstraction through practice by using abstract classes in your programs. Abstraction is one of the key principles to object-oriented design and is often asked about in coding interviews. Abstraction can also help you level up your technical solutions."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Add encapsulation to your programs to impress interviewers","timeRequired":"PT4M2S","description":"Review how to add encapsulation to your programs with public and private access modifiers. Encapsulation is a foundational concept in object oriented programming and while it might be asked about in your technical interview, using encapsulation in your coding solution in the right scenarios will help you stand out as a candidate."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Leveraging inheritance in your technical interview solutions","timeRequired":"PT9M15S","description":"Discover how to make your code more reusable and scalable by adding inheritance. One essential principle of object oriented design is inheritance and leveraging this concept in your Java whiteboard interviews can impress your interviewer."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Use polymorphism to reduce complexity in coding interviews","timeRequired":"PT5M40S","description":"Review how polymorphism can reduce complexity and code in your application. As a foundational concept to object orientation, polymorphism may come up in your interview, where your interviewer may ask you to define the concept or use polymorphism in an example so it's important to review what polymorphism is and how it can be used in Java."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Mastering polymorphism with a deeper look at Java","timeRequired":"PT7M53S","description":"Learn how Java uses polymorphism by diving into the built-in ArrayList class and a few built-in interfaces. But what exactly does it mean to be CTO? In this course, Drew Falkman provides an overview of the responsibilities and skills that are necessary to be a successful CTO. First, learn the most important aspect: building and managing your team. Then, learn about driving innovation, developing great products, and managing all aspects of technology for your company or organization."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What you should know","timeRequired":"PT1M16S"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Being CTO is a people job","timeRequired":"PT1M57S","description":"Ultimately, the role of CTO is a management position. The CTO is in charge of technology initiatives within the organization, and as such, it is very important that she is adept at working with people. Simply put, the CTO needs a good team. In this section, learn what it takes to build a stellar team and inspire them to greatness."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Hire a great team","timeRequired":"PT6M29S","description":"A team is only as strong as its weakest members, and technical skills are only part of the equation. In this video, learn some key aspects of choosing the right team members and how to find people who can bring you to the next level."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Outsourcing","timeRequired":"PT5M29S","description":"Many CTOs explore the option of outsourcing some or all of their technology. Learn the right reasons for doing so, and when to keep it in house. Additionally, discover the costs and benefits of using overseas developers, and when it's better to work with an agency or use individuals."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Creating a great corporate culture","timeRequired":"PT5M34S","description":"One of the key impacts a CTO can have on his organization is the creation of a corporate culture that inspires people to be productive, inspired, and happy with their work environment. Setting the right culture can determine how innovative your products are, how long people stay, and possibly whether your product will succeed in the marketplace."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Enhancing team communications","timeRequired":"PT4M28S","description":"Making sure that everyone communicates is a key aspect of running a smooth technology team. Learn a number of techniques and technologies you can use to enhance communications and make sure that everyone knows what everyone else is working on, that they are doing it correctly, and that breakdowns can be resolved efficiently."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Remote teams and culture","timeRequired":"PT4M48S","description":"The COVID pandemic of 2020 sped up the adoption of remote working. While in many ways, remote work offers people flexibility, it can be challenging managing remote teams and ensuring everyone is productive and collaborative. In this video, learn some techniques for making remote teams run more smoothly."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Firing‚Äîsometimes you have to do it","timeRequired":"PT4M23S","description":"As a manager, you always hope that you hire the right people, and that you are able to train and nurture them to be an optimal team, but there are times when you need to get rid of people. Learn how to recognize toxic people, and how to expunge them before they poison your team. In addition, learn how to let people down easy in those times when you have to lay off employees for reasons beyond your control."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Your job is the product","timeRequired":"PT1M59S","description":"As CTO, you need to have a strong handle on business objectives relating to your apps (for example, what is best for the company), but also a strong handle on the users of your app (for example, what is best for the customers). You are the representative of technology to business stakeholders, and must help them understand what is possible. In addition, you are the representative of business and user needs to developers."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Product Strategy","timeRequired":"PT4M13S","description":"Product Strategy is the practice of planning out your product vision and how it is implemented. It is a mixture of listening to your users, your business objectives, and utilizing technology. Crafting a good product strategy helps to ensure that your products are successful."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Capture and use data and analytics","timeRequired":"PT3M59S","description":"Measuring and understanding data and analytics is a key role of the CTO. It is important that you are gathering data‚Äîespecially in regards to your KPI‚Äîand both understanding it and using it, as well as presenting it to relevant parties within your organization. In this video, learn some of the key tools you can use to do this and be shown some sample analytics to better understand how you can capitalize on data."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Identifying key performance indicators","timeRequired":"PT3M35S","description":"Key performance indicators (KPIs) are data points that help you determine whether or not your product is working. It is very important to set KPIs to ensure that you can measure success and continually make your apps more efficient."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"A/B and multivariate testing","timeRequired":"PT2M45S","description":"In order to improve KPIs, it is important to test different user interface and user experience elements to find the best ways to accomplish tasks. A/B testing is the process of testing two different options to find the best, and multivariate testing is testing multiple elements simultaneously. Implementing this kind of testing can be critical to optimizing your apps."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"The great platform choice","timeRequired":"PT5M33S","description":"One of the most lasting decisions you can make as CTO is what platforms to use. This can be your web development and Application Programming Interface platform, whether to go native with mobile apps, or which frameworks and libraries to use for what tasks. In this video, learn what criteria by which to make this determination and other tips to make the best decision you can."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Hosting and servers","timeRequired":"PT3M27S","description":"No matter what your app's focus, you most likely have a server somewhere. Whether you are a SaaS provider, a mobile app company, or even a brick and mortar with mission critical apps, you have a server with very important data and functionality residing on it. As CTO, you are likely responsible for this server and making sure that it performs, is backed up, and even scales with your corporation. In this video, learn some of the options and techniques to make this critical decision."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Innovation and spotting opportunity","timeRequired":"PT4M2S","description":"As CTO, it will be very important for you to be constantly innovating. You are at the helm of your company's innovation, and it is your responsibility to make sure your apps are better than your competitor's and that you can quickly solve problems with innovative solutions. In this video, learn a few tricks that will help keep you and your team innovating."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Continual process improvement","timeRequired":"PT3M26S","description":"Processes can help you overcome sticky personnel issues, coding problems, communication gaps, and many of the other issues that arise when managing a group of people. In this video, learn how to spot areas that are ripe for solutions by process, and how to create processes that are effective, and most importantly, that people will use."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"R&D for you and your team","timeRequired":"PT3M55S","description":"Research and development is an important part of every technical organization. You will need to make sure that you are up to date on the latest technologies as they relate to your business. You will be responsible for ensuring that your team has the latest tools, and you should always be testing new apps and new features for your existing apps."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Buy vs. build","timeRequired":"PT3M24S","description":"Deciding whether to build an app or use an existing app or service is a critical question that requires good strategy. In this video, learn the key factors and methodologies to help you make the buy vs. build decision."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"The product life cycle","timeRequired":"PT4M15S","description":"The product life cycle (PLC) or Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) is the entire development cycle of any application‚Äîfrom conception to planning, implementation, testing, deployment, and eventually upgrades. Managing the PLC is a fundamental task of any CTO. In this video, learn the key elements of the PLC."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Understanding users and business case","timeRequired":"PT3M27S","description":"The first step in planning any application is to understand both the business case and the user case for your app. For the business, you need to determine why you are developing the app, what your goals are, and where it may lead. Your users may be an internal user, another business, or a consumer. Also in this video, learn how to create personas or typical users who can be used throughout the planning, design, and development stages to test if your app is on target."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Defining the requirements","timeRequired":"PT2M32S","description":"Once you have a thorough understanding of the business case and your users, you need to define what the overall requirements are of the application. If you are using the Agile methodology, you start by defining user stories and prioritizing them. For other methodologies, you need to create a requirements document that fully defines what you build."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Create wireframes and user flows","timeRequired":"PT2M52S","description":"Before doing any design, you will need to determine what general screens you will have and what UI elements those screens will contain‚Äîthese are the wireframes. Then, you will need to determine the appropriate flow‚Äîhow users will move from screen to screen, especially in relation to certain tasks, such as registering for your app."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"The design process","timeRequired":"PT4M7S","description":"Now that you have your basic wireframes, you are ready to get designers involved. In this video, learn how to work with designers and optimize the process of getting composites, or comps‚Äîthe mockups of your app screens‚Äîdesigned for you. Learn some key ways to prepare for and manage this process to get the best app for you and your users."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"The prototype process","timeRequired":"PT3M24S","description":"The next step in the design process is to bring your screens together into user flows to create a prototype. This is a fully visual and non-functional version of your app that shows any stakeholders‚Äîas well as developers‚Äîhow the app functions. This is a good time to get any final feedback before you actually start building your app."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How to take feedback","timeRequired":"PT3M19S","description":"During the entire planning process, you will be getting feedback from stakeholders, and hopefully from others inside your organization. This feedback can be very important, both for your career (as in absorbing the CEO's feedback) and for the app, and it is important to learn how to cull out the good feedback from the bad."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Minimum viable product","timeRequired":"PT3M6S","description":"The minimum viable product (MVP) is generally the first item to come out of the development process if you are starting on a product from the ground floor. You will need to learn the importance of an MVP and how to determine which features to include and what kinds of things you will want to avoid in this stage of the development process."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Testing and continuous integration","timeRequired":"PT4M17S","description":"Testing and quality assurance are important parts of the development process. In this video, learn the different types of testing‚Äìuser testing, unit testing, and regressive testing‚Äìas well as the best ways to include testing in your Q/A process depending on what level you are in‚Äîlean, growth or enterprise."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Public speaking","timeRequired":"PT3M38S","description":"As a core representative of your company, the CTO is likely to have to present something. This may be presenting a new app to the rest of the company, or presenting your technology at a developers' conference. Whatever it is, your public speaking abilities can help you find better developers and promote your company as innovative, as well as promote your own brand as a technologist."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Running efficient meetings","timeRequired":"PT3M13S","description":"Many technical people loathe meetings, but meetings are the lifeblood of any organization‚Äîit is a quick way to communicate between groups of people. In this video, learn how to host efficient meetings and present your information as effectively as possible. There are different types of meetings you can have, and you will need to be able to take charge and make sure that objectives are met so people can get what they need and get back to work."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Decks, pitching, and fundraising","timeRequired":"PT5M25S","description":"If you are working at a startup, a key part of the role of CTO will be to communicate the technology vision to investors, advisors, and partners. As such, you will need to contribute information to creating your company deck, and you will very likely have to take part in the pitching process to investors, incubators, accelerators, and potential partners."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Marketing and launching products","timeRequired":"PT4M54S","description":"While CTOs generally aren't in charge of marketing, in lean startups, it is very common that you will participate. It is also very common for the CTO to have a large hand in product launches, both in leading up to the launch, but often in actually executing the launch. In this video, learn different techniques for having private and public betas, soft launches, and hard launches."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"A note on messaging and emails","timeRequired":"PT3M40S","description":"CTOs spend a lot of time answering messages. Emails. Skype IMs. Slack. Regardless of the tool, it is very important for you to set boundaries, and for you and your team to use these tools effectively. In this video, learn key techniques that will help you maintain productivity while still allowing people to get a hold of you if necessary."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"The many hats of entrepreneurs","timeRequired":"PT2M31S","description":"As CTO of a lean or growth company, you are an entrepreneur. As such, you are not subject to an explicit and tight job definition. In fact, in many cases it is extremely fluid and you may spend one moment working on a sales call, another handling tech support, and even working on marketing or operational issues. The bottom line is that a lot needs to get done in a small company, so you may need to chip in where you can."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Being proactive","timeRequired":"PT4M14S","description":"In the worst of cases, a CTO can end up working weekends, pulling all-nighters prior to a product launch, being bogged down with issues and flooded with crises. One of the more important skills of any aspiring CTO is to be proactive‚Äîin communication and in planning‚Äîso as to avoid having to constantly react to crises."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Managing up","timeRequired":"PT3M26S","description":"As CTO, you will report directly to the CEO, and often need to get buy-in from the COO (operations), CFO (finance) and even VPs of Sales or other parts of the organization. Learning how to work well with your co-managers and create a healthy relationship with your CEO will make you a stronger and more effective CTO."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"P/L and business numbers","timeRequired":"PT5M50S","description":"Being in charge of budgets and financing is frequently a new experience for CTOs. In this video, learn about basic business accounting skills that can help you navigate the world of finance that you will undoubtedly need to refer to on occasion. Basic budgeting, profit and loss, EBITDA, and other accounting principles will be covered."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Growing and scaling","timeRequired":"PT5M30S","description":"In this video, learn what you can expect when scaling based on what phase of company you are in‚Äîlean, growth and small-to-medium enterprise. This includes some basic management hierarchies, hosting options, and processes."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Managing crises","timeRequired":"PT2M33S","description":"Sometimes things go wrong. A critical bug slips through the cracks. A server goes down. A demo fails during an important pitch. Unfortunately, when technology fails, guess who ends up on the hook? You, the CTO. In this course, you have learned many ways to prepare for and prevent these problems. When they happen, it's important for you to keep your cool, get the problem resolved, and then begin the work of finding and preventing it from happening again‚Äîand reassuring your customers and managers."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Next steps","timeRequired":"PT40S"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1039,"ratingValue":4.7,"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},"review":[{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Kartik Aslia","jobTitle":"Machine Learning Engineer (Python) | Backend Developer (JavaScript, TypeScript) | MongoDB & PostgreDB Prisma | Web Developer | AI - In this video, learn why it's better to search for the company you want to work at first and then see what jobs would be a good fit."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Finding a good company fit","timeRequired":"PT3M51S","description":"In general, members of marginalized groups would love to work in an environment where they are free to work and create without dodging daily microaggressions or being actively oppressed. In this video, learn what kind of company you need to deliver your best."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Doing your research","timeRequired":"PT5M4S","description":"In this video, learn how to conduct your research to find good companies you want to work for."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Finding the job","timeRequired":"PT4M12S","description":"Once you know what company you want to work for, you want to know what kind of jobs are available for you. In this video, learn how to uncover those jobs and what to do if you don't see an open job listing for your exact fit."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Interviewing for the job","timeRequired":"PT4M2S","description":"In this video, learn what questions to ask during the interview process to help deepen your understanding of the company culture."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Being effective in tech","timeRequired":"PT3M21S","description":"Tech job descriptions sometimes miss key traits you should master to be considered good at your job. In this video, learn about the traits and expectations of an effective tech practitioner regardless of what you specialize in."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Learning through projects","timeRequired":"PT3M35S","description":"Whatever your technical skill, you want a solid understanding of how to leverage that skill to solve problems. In this video, learn how to use project-based learning for doing that."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Engaging in active learning","timeRequired":"PT2M51S","description":"An effective tech practitioner is always learning. That doesn't necessarily mean taking courses or earning certificates. In this video, learn how to supplement those methods with an active learning mindset so you can keep up with the ever-changing tech industry."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Collaborating your way to wins","timeRequired":"PT3M22S","description":"In this video, learn about the value of collaboration in tech. Innovation and problem solving don't happen in a vacuum. Understanding how to engage with others and build on collective ideas and iteration helps to bring you plenty of aha moments while you're working through challenges."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Centering the user","timeRequired":"PT2M47S","description":"In this video, learn about the value of user driven design in tech. Centering the user means doing work that isn't just fun or cool; it's also useful and solves a specific problem for the person who ends up using or being impacted by the technology you're contributing to."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Leading yourself","timeRequired":"PT3M37S","description":"What moves you? When are you at your best? Knowing the answer to questions like these ensures you're always putting yourself in a position to deliver your best work. In this video, learn about key aspects to understand about yourself to be successful, satisfied, and fulfilled."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Developing confidence","timeRequired":"PT3M16S","description":"Ah, confidence. So very elusive. Especially when imposter syndrome is slapping you in the face. In this video, learn some strategies for building your confidence up over time."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Strengthening your emotional intelligence","timeRequired":"PT4M4S","description":"This video addresses those times when you're excited about sharing your input or giving constructive feedback but aren't sure how best to go about it. In this video, learn about emotional intelligence and how to strengthen yours."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Discerning road blocks from building blocks","timeRequired":"PT3M51S","description":"An unfortunate but real experience for many members of historically marginalized groups is that some people are actively engaged in holding you back. In this video, learn how to tell the difference between someone giving you supportive and constructive feedback or someone who is being disingenuous."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Owning your money matters","timeRequired":"PT3M23S","description":"In this video, learn how to retain your power of choice and health through financial wellness. While attempting to navigate the race and gender pay gaps, getting your money in order has a big impact. It's a safety net in place that bolsters your confidence and removes fear during negotiations for salary or pay raises."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Next steps","timeRequired":"PT29S","description":"In this video, explore resources for building up a portfolio online to showcase tech projects you‚Äôve done and courses on LIL that cover leadership or communication topics that may interest you."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":148,"ratingValue":4.8,"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},"review":[{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Dr. Ling Foon, Chan","jobTitle":"Programme Leader of Master of Finance ODL","url":"https://my.linkedin.com/in/dr-ling-foon-chan-1a390236"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":5},"reviewBody":"Great! Explore examples of tech gone wrong‚Äîand how to avoid ethical issues in your own projects‚Äîin this lighthearted course.","duration":"PT1M31S","datePublished":"2020-05-22","uploadDate":"2020-05-22","requiresSubscription":true,"isAccessibleForFree":false,"contentUrl":"https://www.linkedin.com/learning/tech-ethics-avoiding-unintended-consequences/ethical-next-steps"}]],"syllabusSections":[{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Technology and consequences","timeRequired":"PT2M3S"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Unintended consequences: History and overview","timeRequired":"PT3M52S","description":"In this video, explore some quick tales of regret from recent history and discover how all of these product design regrets started with the same thing: the best of intentions and happened because there was a lack of structure to design with foresight."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"We are all ethicists","timeRequired":"PT1M39S","description":"This video introduces why ethics matters and how ethics is up to everyone to uphold. Get introduced to the concept of individual responsibility‚Äîvs. groupthink‚Äîand hear stories from history where this has failed such as the Quebec civil engineer‚Äôs story and the order of the ring and why a concept like this is missing from the norms around making tech products."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Imagining future risk today","timeRequired":"PT1M22S","description":"As tech evolves faster each day, risks that at first glance appear to be far off in some distant science-fiction future can very suddenly appear and disrupt your present. In this video, get introduced to the concept of envisioning risk and discover why it's a critical tool to create technology responsibly."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"The wheel of misfortune: Eight emerging risk zones","timeRequired":"PT4M59S","description":"In this video, explore all other areas of mounting concern as of today such as truth, disinformation, propaganda, addiction and the attention economy, economic and asset inequalities, machine ethics and algorithmic biases, surveillance state, data control and monetization, implicit trust and user understanding, and hateful and criminal actors. In this video, get a zoomed-out view of the risk areas discussed in the following videos."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Risk zone 1: Truth, disinformation, and propaganda","timeRequired":"PT1M52S","description":"What might it take to safeguard your product, organization, or service from disinformation? In this video, learn how to visualize the scale of the threat, whether it applies to your business, and in what way."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Risk zone 2: Addiction and the dopamine economy","timeRequired":"PT2M17S","description":"Are your performance metrics set up properly not just for business goals but also for the mental health of your users? In this video, explore a new consideration for how to measure what matters instead of defaulting to unhealthy attention-based metrics."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Risk zone 3: Economic and asset inequalities","timeRequired":"PT1M35S","description":"Typically, thinking through economic shifts isn't something you do every quarter with your startup, but in this video, explore a perspective on how many swaths of society have less purchasing power and more debt. Learn how to protect your business from downsides by not making assumptions about the steady state of the economy."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Risk zone 4: Machine ethics and algorithmic bias","timeRequired":"PT6M54S","description":"In this video, review all of the sneaky places algorithmic bias can show up through the eyes of an end user. Walk away with more empathy and some ideas on how to build products that don't accidentally disadvantage your users."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Risk zone 5: Surveillance state","timeRequired":"PT6M36S","description":"Facial recognition and security cameras are more known entities in surveillance, but as your technology develops and you have more devices at home and more medical and genetic testing at home shared with more and more databases, explore a scenario where your product loses all trust. In this video, get an idea of how to respond to a privacy breach where you least expected it."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Risk zone 6: Data control and monetization","timeRequired":"PT1M40S","description":"There's no such thing as a free lunch or a free service. In this video, walk through a scenario where data exhaust monetization becomes abusive to users and users start fighting back. In this video, discover tools with which to design your product with more empathy and potentially an alternative business model."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Risk zone 7: Implicit trust and user understanding","timeRequired":"PT1M42S","description":"In this video, discover how Terms of Service checkboxes are one of the most abused norms in technology products today. Learn how to think about transparency as a key value for your TOS."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Risk zone 8: Hateful and criminal actors","timeRequired":"PT1M30S","description":"In this video, walk through a scenario where criminals can now easily control your devices and electric cars, and demand ransom to let you use them again. Learn how to future-proof your technology and build in failsafes should your product get hacked in this way."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Why use checklists?","timeRequired":"PT1M6S","description":"In this video, walk through some key questions that you can apply today to your product and processes. Highlight checklist examples such as ‚ÄúHave you ensured your training data sets are free from bias?‚Äù and ‚ÄúAre your terms of service easily understandable?‚Äù"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Example checklist","timeRequired":"PT1M36S","description":"In this video, learn how to create your own checklist working from a template and cover the basics of structuring a list that applies specifically to your product and industry."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Customize your checklist","timeRequired":"PT1M22S","description":"In this video, learn how to create your own checklist, working from a template, and explore the basics of structuring a list that applies specifically to your product and industry."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Accountability: Making change stick","timeRequired":"PT2M34S","description":"There‚Äôs no point to go through the effort of creating a checklist if you‚Äôre not going to put some accountability in place. In this video, discover some simple hacks to easily integrate checklists, including designating one person on the team to run point on the integration, and ensure that checklists get added to daily standup or quarterly product reviews as well as apply to any new features."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Ethical next steps","timeRequired":"PT1M31S"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":849,"ratingValue":4.7,"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},"review":[{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Dilupa Wickramasinghe","jobTitle":"General Manager (Sri Lanka & Maldives) at MCLARENS LUBRICANTS LIMITED","url":"https://lk.linkedin.com/in/dilupa-wickramasinghe-14b21457"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":5},"reviewBody":"Good","datePublished":"2024-08-28T02:03:33.209Z","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"LinkedIn"},"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Karanja Ndegwa","jobTitle":"CEO & Managing Director at Jambojet","url":"https://ke.linkedin.com/in/karanja-ndegwa-03164422"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":5},"reviewBody":"We may mean well but we need to check on the unintended risks of technology","datePublished":"2024-08-26T05:26:11.451Z","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"LinkedIn"},"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1}],"video":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Technology and consequences - Tech Ethics: Avoiding Unintended Consequences","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Raina Kumra","description":"Don't try to put me in a box. Before getting into the weeds of social engineering tactics and defense mechanisms for social engineering, you need to know what social engineering is."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Influence and decision-making","timeRequired":"PT2M47S","description":"In this video, learn what effect fear, urgency, and doubt have on human beings. Understanding the psychology behind why social engineering attacks are successful can assist you in shaping your defensive actions to be as effective as possible."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Phishing","timeRequired":"PT3M9S","description":"In this video, learn what phishing is and gain a general idea of how to combat it. Phishing plagues many organizations and tends to be the easiest way for attackers to successfully gain information from employees."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Pretexting","timeRequired":"PT2M19S","description":"In this video, learn about pretext and identify how attackers use pretext to exploit employees. Pretext is a tool regularly used in creating good quality social engineering attacks with higher rates of success. It is important to be familiar with pretexting to arm your staff with the appropriate tools to circumvent it."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Vishing","timeRequired":"PT1M59S","description":"In this video, learn another method of phishing. Some users are more susceptible to vishing attacks than others and it is important to be aware of all methods of phishing."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Baiting","timeRequired":"PT2M30S","description":"In this video, learn how employees can be baited into providing information or downloading malicious software. The knowledge of baiting can equip you with information to include in any training given to employees, assisting in mitigating the risk of employees falling susceptible to it."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Tailgating and shoulder surfing","timeRequired":"PT2M57S","description":"In this video, learn how to identify what tailgating and shoulder surfing is and ways to limit them. Things have shifted since Covid-19 and people need to be more diligent about physical security, especially in hybrid work environments."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Challenge: Social engineering tactics","timeRequired":"PT2M33S"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Solution: Social engineering tactics","timeRequired":"PT2M23S"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Cybersecurity awareness training","timeRequired":"PT3M17S","description":"In this video, learn the importance of cybersecurity awareness training. You cannot be everywhere at every moment, so it is important to inform users of appropriate ways to combat social engineering threats to your organization."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Properly manage passwords","timeRequired":"PT3M12S","description":"In this video, learn what makes a strong password, how to properly store passwords, and the dos and don'ts of password management."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Install patches","timeRequired":"PT2M28S","description":"In this video, learn why patching is important and should be a required process. Software companies provide security fixes to their software regularly, which can help reduce a system's vulnerability."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Spam filter","timeRequired":"PT1M55S","description":"In this video, learn how spam filters play a role in decreasing the amount of spam and phishing emails you receive. Volume can sometimes lead to an oversight, so lowering the volume of emails that need to be investigated can help make your job easier."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Sandboxing","timeRequired":"PT2M27S","description":"In this video, learn what sandboxing is and the role it plays in defending your organization against social engineering attacks. Executing malicious code in sandboxes prevents viruses and malware from spreading across the network."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Scan your attachments","timeRequired":"PT2M5S","description":"In this video, learn how to identify the effect that scanning email attachments can have on workflow and attack mitigation. Having your email security gateway remove malicious attachments before it gets to the end user can help reduce some risk."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Anti-social engineering software","timeRequired":"PT2M2S","description":"In this video, learn how defense in depth can help make it harder for attackers to gain access to sensitive or unauthorized information. The more layers of security that you have, the harder it makes it for an attacker to completely compromise a system."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Create policies and procedures","timeRequired":"PT2M39S","description":"In this video, learn how to identify which policies and procedures can help enforce some of the methods discussed in this section. Policies and procedures help enforce certain behaviors and instruct users on how to carry out those behaviors."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Challenge: Safegarding your company from attacks","timeRequired":"PT46S"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Solution: Safegarding your company from attacks","timeRequired":"PT2M44S"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Phishing simulations","timeRequired":"PT1M51S","description":"In this video, learn how to see the value of phishing simulations. Phishing simulations can give you an idea of how effective cybersecurity awareness training is."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Penetration testing","timeRequired":"PT2M18S","description":"In this video, learn how to identify what a penetration test is and what value it provides your organization. Penetration tests assist in identifying weaknesses in your organization after you have implemented the corrections to vulnerabilities that you have identified."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Active and passive education","timeRequired":"PT2M18S","description":"In this video, learn how to identify a method of disseminating cybersecurity awareness information to users. It is one of the many ways used to inform users on how to develop more secure practices. Also, learn how to appreciate the value of passive education."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Personal data security","timeRequired":"PT1M31S","description":"In this video, learn how to make cybersecurity awareness relate to the user's personal life. Making general security make sense to a user can help create a more vested interest in secure practices moving forward."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Continue your cybersecurity awareness journey","timeRequired":"PT1M34S","description":"In this video, get a recap of what you learned and discover any actionable steps needed to implement what you've learned."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":749,"ratingValue":4.7,"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},"review":[{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Ana Serrano Barrera","jobTitle":"","url":"https://mx.linkedin.com/in/anaserranob"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":5},"reviewBody":"N/A","datePublished":"2024-07-16T20:37:41.530Z","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"LinkedIn"},"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Kara Church","jobTitle":"Advisory Technical Editor at Jack Henry & Associates","url":"https://www.linkedin.com/in/kara-church-1871828"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":5},"reviewBody":"I took her Phishing and Malware classes and thought they were great. This video explores the breadth of the pentesting field, its positioning in cybersecurity at large, and basic ideas regarding career entry."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Interaction skills","timeRequired":"PT2M27S","description":"Explore common skills and traits for pentesters that can help determine if a career in pentesting is right for you. In this video, learn how to assess whether you've got the skills or if you need to work to develop skills in those areas. Are you good at problem-solving, continual learning, and report writing? Learn how to identify the soft skills that are necessary for a career in pentesting."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Technical skills","timeRequired":"PT4M19S","description":"Explore the common technical skills that are needed for skills in pentesting. Do you have a good understanding of networking and how web applications are built? You don't have to be a developer, you just have to know how they think. In this video, learn how to identify the technical skills that are necessary for a career in pentesting."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"OS fundamentals","timeRequired":"PT2M39S","description":"All operating systems are not created equal, knowing what to look for is as important as knowing where to look. In this video, you are introduced to the different types of operating systems, how to identify them, and why knowledge of the traits of each OS type is important to careers in pentesting."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Risk fundamentals","timeRequired":"PT3M56S","description":"So many threats, so little time. It's important to identify high-risk activities versus low-risk ones to help direct penetration testing. In this video, you are introduced to the concept of risk and how an understanding of risk can help you hone your penetration testing surface area."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Web and network fundamentals","timeRequired":"PT3M12S","description":"Knowing how to use a web application is not the same as knowing how to test it. In this video, learn about the features common across web applications that are important to navigating web applications during penetration tests. Looking for vulnerabilities is a lot easier when you know where to look. You are also introduced to the fundamentals of networks that are important to performing network penetration tests."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Penetration testing stages","timeRequired":"PT3M1S","description":"The phases of a penetration test are the same regardless of the type of penetration testing being performed. In this video, learn how to identify the steps that are included in every penetration test and what should be accomplished in each step."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Linux command-line fundamentals","timeRequired":"PT3M51S","description":"Can you tell someone how to get to the password file? Navigation in Linux is not typically the point-and-click navigation that people are used to.  In this video, you are introduced to Linux command line tools that are important to navigating networks during penetration tests."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Tools of the trade required for pentesting","timeRequired":"PT2M59S","description":"There is no one right way to perform a penetration test, there are a wide variety of tools that can be used that perform the same goal. In this video, you are introduced to common tools that are used for penetration testing."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Hands-on experience","timeRequired":"PT3M31S","description":"Recruiters can overlook a lack of certification and education if the candidate has demonstrated experience. In this video, you are introduced to ways that you can practice your penetration testing skills and be able to demonstrate that experience during interviews."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Showing home lab as experience","timeRequired":"PT2M21S","description":"Why do you need experience to get experience? In this video, learn how to represent your home lab as experience on your resume and LinkedIn profiles."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What are you waiting for?","timeRequired":"PT31S","description":"People often think that they've got to go and get more certifications, more education, and more time before they can pursue a career in pentesting. In this video, learn what it takes to keep your skills sharp in this ever-changing, fast-paced industry."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What is software development?","timeRequired":"PT2M12S","description":"Software development involves various processes related to the design, development, and delivery of software. Programmers play a vital role in these processes. Learn about that role in this video."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"The software development process","timeRequired":"PT3M32S","description":"This video describes the software development process. This process is what allows companies to produce software of high quality in a timely, efficient manner."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Explore the various roles in software development","timeRequired":"PT2M39S","description":"Programmers aren't the only ones involved in creating software. In this video, learn about the different tools and match them to their purpose."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Getting software to customers","timeRequired":"PT3M14S","description":"Once software is developed, the next step is getting it to customers. Learn how programmers use version control systems to safely make updates to their code."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Tour various code repository services","timeRequired":"PT2M49S","description":"Repository hosting services are third-party web applications that wrap and enhance a version control system. Take a tour of various services in this video to learn about their different strengths and weaknesses."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Introduction to libraries and frameworks","timeRequired":"PT3M11S","description":"Don't reinvent the wheel. You'll hear this often in programming. One way programmers adhere to this advice is by using code written by other programmers. Libraries and frameworks are one way to package that code."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Survey different types of IDEs","timeRequired":"PT2M38S","description":"An IDE, or integrated development environment, is how programmers write, test, debug, and deploy their code. This video surveys various types of IDEs."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Learn where to get help","timeRequired":"PT2M16S","description":"Being able to find answers when you run into issues writing your programs will make you a more successful programmer.
