While building technology, it is essential to recognize and minimize bias. This course guides in identifying bias and provides best practices to reduce bias in code, actions, and products."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What is unconscious bias?","timeRequired":"PT3M38S","description":"Everyone is biased, but it's impossible to identify without a solid understanding of what it is and what may drive it. In this video, learn how to level set the basics of unconscious bias with examples from the tech industry."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Types of unconscious bias","timeRequired":"PT3M11S","description":"There are several types of unconscious bias, and each may have a different impact on your team or your product. In this video, explore common types of bias and learn how they can impact decision-making and what you build."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Why it is important to identify bias?","timeRequired":"PT1M51S","description":"People's lives are increasingly affected by the technology that they use every day. For example, what news they see, who is stopped by police, the products they buy, and what skin color triggers an automatic water faucet. As technology advancements continue to grow, identifying bias in the process is critical to building inclusive technology."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Bias in tech recruitment","timeRequired":"PT4M54S","description":"Hiring tools can introduce bias and discrimination, excluding qualified job seekers. Learn how to identify common bias in recruitment by looking at specific examples in tech."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Bias in tech processes","timeRequired":"PT2M51S","description":"Having an unbiased approach to gather user requirements and having diverse personas is key to creating inclusive products. This video identifies some common business processes that enable bias while building tech products."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Bias in tech products","timeRequired":"PT3M43S","description":"Technology can be biased based on who builds it, how it's developed, and how it's used. Identification is the first step towards reducing it."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Types of data bias","timeRequired":"PT4M42S","description":"Data bias occurs due to the systems' structural characteristics that produce the data. In this video, explore the different kinds of data bias."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Methods to avoid data bias","timeRequired":"PT4M6S","description":"There are several methods to avoid data bias, which can have a positive impact on your product builds. In this video, dig into practices to minimize bias while building and shipping data products."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Algorithmic bias","timeRequired":"PT5M22S","description":"Algorithms are everywhere, making decisions on your behalf in ways that are often vague. How many times do you get advertised higher prices? How many times are you not seeing specific job ads? Examine the different algorithmic bias examples in everyday use."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How to build inclusive technology","timeRequired":"PT3M27S","description":"In this video, explore actionable steps to reduce bias from your data, actions, and algorithms."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Next steps","timeRequired":"PT49S","description":"In this video, discover the next steps for action and review the downloadable takeaway guide for applying learnings."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":129,"ratingValue":4.6,"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},"review":[{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"James Chu, RN, MBA, BN","jobTitle":"Medical Analyst Researcher @ The Canadian Medical Protective Association | RN, MBA","url":"https://ca.linkedin.com/in/james-chu-rn-mba-bn-615bba165"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":5},"reviewBody":"Great short learning module and integrates approaches to breaking bias in technology. In this video, learn how to manage your first hour as a data scientist would."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Handling distractions and delays","timeRequired":"PT1M52S","description":"Distractions are part of any job. In this video, learn how to schedule your calendar to account for distractions and delays."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Using to-do lists","timeRequired":"PT1M14S","description":"Machine learning can do a lot, but only you can make an accurate to-do list. In this video, learn how to determine how to prioritize your tasks to accomplish your tasks and your goals."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Unpacking the data","timeRequired":"PT1M29S","description":"Depending on your task, you may spend a long time just trying to understand your data. In this video, learn how to focus your questions to get answers efficiently."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Minimum viable product","timeRequired":"PT32S","description":"The first question you should be asking is \"What is the minimum viable product?\" In this video, learn how to quickly determine the MVP in any request."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Managing meetings","timeRequired":"PT1M25S","description":"Meetings are part of the job. But in this video, learn how to manage your role in meetings and gather the necessary info you need."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Big picture thinking","timeRequired":"PT1M32S","description":"You need to have goals in order to achieve them. In this video, learn how to set aside time to work on your goals."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Exploratory data","timeRequired":"PT2M3S","description":"There's a lot that you can do with data. In this video, learn what it's like to be an exploratory data scientist."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Biased data sets","timeRequired":"PT2M57S","description":"It's almost impossible to remove bias from data. In this video, learn how to have strategies for how to mitigate bias in data."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Responsibilities of data analytics","timeRequired":"PT1M4S","description":"With great data comes great responsibility. In this video, learn how to be equipped with questions that help you become a responsible data scientist."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Identifying the problem","timeRequired":"PT1M17S","description":"Solving the right problem is crucial. In this video, learn how to identify the most important problem and prioritize from there."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Presenting data findings","timeRequired":"PT3M42S","description":"Presenting your findings is a big part of being a data scientist. In this video, learn how to present in a clear and concise manner."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Telling the story of the data","timeRequired":"PT1M13S","description":"Numbers mean nothing without reason. In this video, learn how to tell a compelling story with your findings and get to the \"why.\""},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Using data to solve business problems","timeRequired":"PT1M4S","description":"Some business problems can be solved with data analysis. In this video, learn how to marry business problems with data solutions."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Automated analytics reporting","timeRequired":"PT1M37S","description":"Automated reporting can help turn your business into a data-driven business. In this video, learn how to find the benefits in automated and accessible reporting dashboards."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Working cross-functionally","timeRequired":"PT50S","description":"No data scientist is an island. In this video, learn how to work cross-departmentally to solve complex business issues."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Setting key milestones","timeRequired":"PT1M31S","description":"Setting up a problem-solving process is critical for success. In this video, learn how to set key milestones to check in along the way."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Data analytics process","timeRequired":"PT5M8S","description":"The analytics process is comprised of a number of steps. In this video, learn how to go from identifying the problem to presenting your findings with room for error."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How to measure success in data science","timeRequired":"PT1M51S","description":"It's important to critique your own work. In this video, learn how to determine what elements were successful and what needs were met."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Knowing when to use which tools","timeRequired":"PT1M51S","description":"There are plenty of tools at your disposal. In this video, learn how to determine which data science tool is the right one for the project."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Using open-source tools","timeRequired":"PT2M42S","description":"Open-source tools are free and collaborative . In this video, learn how to start working with open-source tools in your analysis."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Python and pandas tools","timeRequired":"PT1M35S","description":"Python and the pandas library are common open-source tools that data scientists use often. In this video, learn how to incorporate these tools into your own workflow."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Jupyter Notebook tools","timeRequired":"PT56S","description":"The Jupyter Notebook is an open-source tool that's great for testing and collaborating on code. In this video, learn how to incorporate this tool into your testing process."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Tableau and G Suite visualization tools","timeRequired":"PT2M15S","description":"Visualizations are a crucial part of data analysis. In this video, learn how to choose which visualization tools are right for the project and budget."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Centralized organization","timeRequired":"PT1M57S","description":"There are many ways to organize a data science team. Learn how to prepare for and conduct interviews to accurately assess a candidate's technical aptitude and overall fit.","duration":"PT54S","datePublished":"2019-12-05","uploadDate":"2019-12-05","requiresSubscription":true,"isAccessibleForFree":false,"contentUrl":"https://www.linkedin.com/learning/tech-career-skills-interviewing-developers/next-steps"}]],"syllabusSections":[{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Technical interviews","timeRequired":"PT1M26S","description":"Most developers interview candidates at some point, usually in an ad hoc fashion. Here's why that can lead to hiring undesirable candidates."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Prepared interviewing yields better results","timeRequired":"PT2M10S","description":"Prepared interviewing pays off with better results. This course explains how to prepare and train to be a better interviewer."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Techniques, questions to ask, and follow-up","timeRequired":"PT2M2S","description":"The flow of the course goes from preparation before the interview begins all the way through to wrapping it up. Here's a summary of the flow and the overall structure of the course."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Technical skills and soft skills","timeRequired":"PT2M5S","description":"A good interview covers both technical and soft skills. A balance of these helps turn up warning signs of a poor candidate."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Have a list of questions ready to use","timeRequired":"PT1M10S","description":"Since development positions require both technical skills and soft skills, it's important to evaluate both. This video covers how a mix of questions for candidates should reflect this need."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Request sample code","timeRequired":"PT2M16S","description":"A candidate's sample code will often tell you more about their skills than a resume. This video suggests how to evaluate sample code, and discusses alternatives such as online tests."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Analyze the resume and cover letter","timeRequired":"PT3M30S","description":"Modern resumes are often generated by a staffing company, but cover letters are written by the candidate. In this video, the goal is to see how to gain maximum benefit from looking at both."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Alphabet soup and why they cook it","timeRequired":"PT1M12S","description":"Resumes often contain a long list of technologies, and candidates rarely know them all. The interviewer should know not to take the list seriously, since it's there just to contributes keywords for a search.¬†"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Neutral vocal tone and body language","timeRequired":"PT3M28S","description":"Candidates are highly motivated to give you answers you like instead of what they really think. Here's how to deal with candidates' attempts to \"read\" the interviewer and respond accordingly."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Warm up for a good candidate","timeRequired":"PT53S","description":"Neutral body language can put off a candidate if it goes on too long. Here we look at how to warm up during the interview to avoid that problem."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"My list of questions","timeRequired":"PT1M39S","description":"The instructor has been interviewing over thirty years. This video explains how he started building a list of useful questions to ask.¬†"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Think back to a system from five years ago","timeRequired":"PT2M43S","description":"This question asks for a critique of a previous system the candidate worked on. It probes both technical and architectural astuteness and potential defensiveness."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"The alphabet soup on a resume","timeRequired":"PT2M3S","description":"One of the ways to detect defensiveness is to ask about the \"alphabet soup\" of technologies on their resume. The goal is to offer a chance to come clean about that."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"The weirdest bug you've ever encountered","timeRequired":"PT1M54S","description":"The \"weirdest bug\" question is one of the most popular in the course. It provides an interesting way to see what kind of depth of challenges a developer has encountered."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Drill down on object orientation","timeRequired":"PT2M51S","description":"Most modern platforms are object oriented. The video discusses several related questions designed to understand depth of understanding of OO concepts."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Hypothetical app needs","timeRequired":"PT1M57S","description":"Many developers are very code-oriented. This question asks about a situation where a code-centric approach won't work, to see if a candidate can step outside a code-based solution."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Dinner with an industry luminary","timeRequired":"PT1M56S","description":"This question invites a candidate to give a broad perspective on the platforms they use. The goal is to see if the candidate thinks deeply or superficially about technology."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Deeper questions","timeRequired":"PT2M21S","description":"This question helps see where a developer wants to go in the future. The video explains how this ties into long term prospects for a candidate."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What's your philosophy of user interface design?","timeRequired":"PT2M32S","description":"This question exposes a common weaknesses in modern developers - their apathy towards the user. This video explains how to evaluate the range of potential answers to the question."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Comparing platforms","timeRequired":"PT2M17S","description":"Some developers are so connected to one platform that they lack perspective on other platforms they might need to use. A well-constructed question can help uncover such an attitude."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Pros and cons of agile methodologies","timeRequired":"PT2M2S","description":"Some developers tend to be emotionally bonded to certain methodologies. The video suggests looking for someone with a more pragmatic approach, who realizes that no process is perfect."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How do you become familiar with new technologies?","timeRequired":"PT1M36S","description":"This question helps determine whether a developer is proactive about learning new things. The goal of the question is to match the needs of the position to the approach of the candidate."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Questions about n-tier architectures","timeRequired":"PT2M5S","description":"Modern n-tier architectures are essential, but many developers do not understand n-tier in depth. This video explains how to gauge their depth based on answers to this question."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"No-win situations","timeRequired":"PT2M59S","description":"Unrealistic deadlines are often imposed by out-of-touch managers. Here you can compare such situations to the \"Kobayashi Maru\" no-win scenario in the Star Trek universe, with a question for which the candidate's response is a test of character."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Team work and individual work","timeRequired":"PT1M14S","description":"In a quest to please the interviewer, a candidate may imply that they did work actually done by their team. Here's how to probe when the interviewer begins to suspect such fudging."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"User experience","timeRequired":"PT1M2S","description":"Interviewers need to create their own questions about the technologies or processes used on your team. This video encourages the viewer to create some of those ahead of time."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Let the candidate ask questions","timeRequired":"PT1M55S","description":"The candidate needs a chance to ask questions too. This video encourages interviewers to look for ones that are perceptive rather than coached questions suggested by their recruiter."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"When a candidate isn't a good fit","timeRequired":"PT1M11S","description":"Some developers just cut off candidates after five minutes if it's clear they're not a fit. The video explains how that engenders hostility towards the interviewer and the company, and what to do instead."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Offer advice to an unsuccessful candidate","timeRequired":"PT1M32S","description":"It's optional to provide candidates with feedback on their skill sets. If you do, be positive and not overbearing, which can turn the candidate into an ally."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Set expectations for what happens next","timeRequired":"PT1M11S","description":"Don't leave candidates hanging, but don't set unrealistic expectations either. Here we look at achieving that balance."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Write down impressions immediately","timeRequired":"PT50S","description":"Get your impressions down as soon as possible after the interview. They may be essential to good hiring decisions later."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Reference checking","timeRequired":"PT1M5S","description":"Sometimes an interviewer is also tasked with reference checking. Here's an approach for it."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"First impressions","timeRequired":"PT1M57S","description":"First impressions are automatic, and happen in about five seconds. This video includes how to use first impressions for evaluation, and some cautions on using them."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Listen more than you talk","timeRequired":"PT1M23S","description":"Especially for quiet candidates, it's easy for the interviewer to talk too much. This video covers techniques to avoid that.¬†"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Work on your listening skills","timeRequired":"PT2M","description":"Most people are poor listeners. This video discusses how successful interviewing requires effective listening, and begins discussion of tips on improving listening skills.¬†"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Additional listening tips","timeRequired":"PT1M27S","description":"Improvement of listening skills requires goals and practice. Here we look at additional tips related to improvement of listening via practice."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Steer the interview","timeRequired":"PT1M24S","description":"It's the interviewer's responsibility to make an interview productive, rather than allowing it to drift and waste time. Here are some ways the interview can drift, and how to avoid them."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Avoid too much socializing","timeRequired":"PT1M36S","description":"Developers are a bit like a tribe, which means socializing during an interview often happens naturally. This video discusses why it's good to avoid letting the interview drift into too much socializing. ¬†"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Business focus or technology focus","timeRequired":"PT2M50S","description":"Some development positions mostly need raw tech skills, while others need business skills. This video explains how to prepare by thinking through these options."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Taking notes","timeRequired":"PT1M14S","description":"You need to take notes during an interview, but it's easy to overdo. The video talks about what notes are important, and why it's a bad idea to be constantly writing while interviewing.¬†"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Interviewing as a team","timeRequired":"PT1M44S","description":"Having multiple interviewers has both advantages and challenges. This video covers some of the ways to make it effective."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Next steps","timeRequired":"PT54S"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":258,"ratingValue":4.7,"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},"review":[{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Brenden Walker","jobTitle":"Tactical Technological Warhead, drop me on a problem and boom it's fixed","url":"https://www.linkedin.com/in/brenden-walker"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":5},"reviewBody":"Over the years I've taken part in interviewing developers, usually in a group (inquisition as noted in this course). In this video, learn how the cycles work."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Promotion ladders, competencies, and levels","timeRequired":"PT3M56S","description":"Companies create objective and measurable criteria to help gauge promotion readiness. In this video, learn how such competencies are created."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Promotion committees","timeRequired":"PT4M13S","description":"Promotion candidates need to comprehend who assesses their promotion packets. In this video, learn how such committees are constituted."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Role of the manager and the engineers","timeRequired":"PT4M3S","description":"Managers of promotion candidates have varying levels of influence in the process. In this video, explore the possibilities, so that candidates can prepare accordingly."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What the committee is looking for by way of impact","timeRequired":"PT3M6S","description":"In order to get promoted, engineers need to demonstrate examples of execution and impact. In this video, learn why that is crucial."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How engineers can show impact","timeRequired":"PT3M","description":"Engineers often fail to explain the what and the why behind their work. In this video, learn how to set that context to make a case for promotion."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What the committee is looking for by way of efficiency","timeRequired":"PT3M8S","description":"In order to get promoted, engineers need to show that their work created business efficiency. In this video, learn why that is critical."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How engineers can show efficiency","timeRequired":"PT2M54S","description":"Engineers struggle to show how their automation helps the overall business. In this video, learn how to plan and execute a strategic vision for the business and the promotion process with and without your manager."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What the committee is looking for in this key competency","timeRequired":"PT2M22S","description":"Being able to show coding proficiency is critical for engineers. In this video, learn about the sorts of signals the committee looks for in assessing coding skills."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How engineers can demonstrate coding chops","timeRequired":"PT3M18S","description":"In this video, explore examples of how candidates can explain their coding skills to a committee that may not be well-versed in the details, in order to make their case clearer."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What the committee is looking for by way of design skill","timeRequired":"PT3M17S","description":"Engineers need to show that they have a technical vision that can drive execution. In this video, learn how to identify some of the signals the committee looks for, so that engineers can prepare accordingly."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How engineers can show design vision","timeRequired":"PT2M53S","description":"In this video, learn how engineers can create well-thought-out technical designs that grow scope and applicability, so that they can demonstrate business benefit as well as promotion readiness."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What the committee is looking for in collaboration","timeRequired":"PT3M22S","description":"In this video, learn what promotion decision-makers look for when judging an engineer's collaboration competencies, so that engineers can plan their work and outreach to build their case."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How engineers can show collaboration","timeRequired":"PT3M14S","description":"In this video, explore examples for engineers of the kinds of activities that can increase effectiveness but also show that they are team players in it for the greater good."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What the committee is looking for by way of citizenship","timeRequired":"PT2M47S","description":"Engineers increasingly need to show that they are in touch with changing social expectations before they get promoted and are given more responsibilities. In this video, learn why that matters."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How engineers can show citizenship","timeRequired":"PT2M37S","description":"In this video, explore examples of how engineers can perform functions that will demonstrate citizenship and help their promotion chances."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Creating an impact resume","timeRequired":"PT3M7S","description":"Being considered for a promotion is akin to applying for a more senior role. In this video, learn how to create an impact resume that will showcase past achievements as a bridge to future possibilities."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How to cultivate references","timeRequired":"PT3M41S","description":"Objective promotion processes will lean on references from senior leaders. In this video, learn how engineers can have validators for their promotion so as to avoid their promotions fail due to lack of corroboration."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How to prep for promotion interviews","timeRequired":"PT2M59S","description":"Senior engineering promotions often require interviews to judge a candidate's communication skills and ability to influence. In this video, learn how to prep for such a conversation, since such training is not typically part of an engineer's day job."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How to process promotion-related feedback","timeRequired":"PT2M39S","description":"Engineers are often allowed to appeal a promotion denial. In this video, learn tips on how to frame an appeal to enable an objective reassessment of your candidacy."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Boost your career","timeRequired":"PT40S"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":54,"ratingValue":4.7,"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},"review":[{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Lucas Guardado","jobTitle":"Tech lead - Senior React / React native Developer at DataArt","url":"https://ar.linkedin.com/in/lucas-guardado"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":2},"reviewBody":"I found this course too boring and repetitive, I had a hard time getting concise value of it. In this video, get introduced to some of the common misconceptions about technical interviews as well as how to stand out as an interview candidate."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Understand the different types of technical interviews","timeRequired":"PT2M7S","description":"Learn about the different types of questions you might get in a C# interview as well as how they might vary so that you can be prepared for any interview situation."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Get ready for your technical interview","timeRequired":"PT1M","description":"Learn how to prepare for technical interviews, even if you're not looking for a new job. In this video, learn how to prepare yourself for any interview opportunity that comes your way."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How to use CoderPad","timeRequired":"PT2M11S","description":"In this video, wgo over how to use the CoderPad tool."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How is C# different from other languages?","timeRequired":"PT2M3S","description":"Each programming language is unique in its own way. In this video, look at the specific features of C# and how it differs from other languages."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What's the difference between C# and .NET?","timeRequired":"PT2M23S","description":"Many often confuse C# and .NET as the same technology, and while they are used together, they are not the same thing. C# is a programming language and .NET is the framework on which the language is built on. In this video, review how they work together in a given software application."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What is Common Language Runtime (CLR)?","timeRequired":"PT1M42S","description":"The CLR manages the execution of .NET programs, many of which are written in C#. In this video, review how the CLR helps with memory management and executing your C# code. Interviewers often ask questions about the CLR because it's a foundational tool used in the C# stack."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Managed vs. unmanaged code","timeRequired":"PT2M54S","description":"The difference between managed and unmanaged code has to do with how the code is built and executed. This has important security implications, which is why it's often asked in interviews."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What are classes, instances, and constructors?","timeRequired":"PT2M44S","description":"Nearly every object in real life can be represented in code with classes and instances of these classes can be created with constructors. In your programming interview, you may be asked a question about one of these topics or asked to create a small program using these concepts. In this video, review how to use classes, instances, and constructors to represent data in your code."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What's the difference between static and non-static members?","timeRequired":"PT6M38S","description":"The difference between static and non-static members is often asked in C# interviews because it is a concise way to see how familiar an interviewee is with adding functionality to classes and using that functionality with instances and inside other functions. In this video, review the differences between static and non-static members as well as which coding scenarios each is useful for."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Boxing vs. unboxing","timeRequired":"PT2M49S","description":"Three different types exist in C#: value types, reference types, and pointers types. Boxing and unboxing allow you to convert between value and reference types. Generally, converting between the two is a bad practice, which is why it's often asked about in interviews."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Pass by reference vs. pass by value","timeRequired":"PT4M43S","description":"Passing by reference versus passing by value can have major implications for your data, making it a common topic in interviews. In this video, review how passing by reference can affect data outside a method call as well as how to use the ref and out keywords."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Readonly versus const","timeRequired":"PT4M13S","description":"The keyword for a constant can have different meanings depending on the programming language. The readonly and const keywords are often confused in C#, but they have different effects on your data, making them a common discussion point in interviews."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Concatenate strings with different methods","timeRequired":"PT2M49S","description":"Review the different ways you can concatenate strings with the concatenation operator, concat method, StringBuilder, and the StringBuffer. In a technical interview, you often need to concatenate strings so it's important to understand the advantages and disadvantages of each method."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Normalize string input","timeRequired":"PT4M55S","description":"Review the different ways you can manipulate individual strings with string methods. Depending on the technical interview question, these string methods are great for normalizing your string input so that you can grab the necessary data from the string."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Validate string input","timeRequired":"PT6M47S","description":"When working with strings in a technical interview, you likely need to validate an input before processing it. In this video, learn how to validate string input so you can make powerful assumptions about your data and improve the efficiency of your technical interview solutions"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Access data from strings","timeRequired":"PT7M30S","description":"Review the different ways you can access data from individual strings using built-in string functionality. Depending on the technical interview question, these string methods can be great tools for efficiently accessing necessary data."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Create algorithm-driven strings in C#","timeRequired":"PT7M","description":"A standard programming task is to create a new string based on input data. In this lesson, learn how to create efficient algorithms that read in a string and use that input data to create a new string."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Solution: Developing a palindrome checker","timeRequired":"PT3M38S","description":"Learn how to write a program that checks if a string is a palindrome. Walk through two potential solutions to this technical interview problem."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Solution: Reverse each word","timeRequired":"PT2M15S","description":"In this lesson, discover how to reverse each word in a sentence using an algorithm."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Review arrays for technical interviews","timeRequired":"PT6M29S","description":"Review the concept of an array and how to use arrays in C# arrays are a useful data structure to use in answering whiteboard coding interviews because, with an array, you can easily sort and retrieve your data by index."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Solution: Maximum product of two numbers","timeRequired":"PT8M7S","description":"Learn how to use indices to find the maximum product of two numbers in an unsorted array. Walk through a few different solutions using arrays, as well common algorithm strategies that can help you during your technical interview."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Mastering linked lists for whiteboard coding interviews","timeRequired":"PT7M29S","description":"Review the advantages and disadvantages of the linked list data structure as well as how to use linked lists in C#. Depending on the technical interview question, you may want to organize your data in a linked list so you can easily modify and retrieve your data in a sequential manner."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Solution: Delete the middle of a linked list","timeRequired":"PT1M9S","description":"Learn how to use slow and fast pointers to delete the middle node of a singly linked list in C#. Using slow and fast pointers with linked lists is a common strategy for solving linked list whiteboard coding questions."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Leverage stacks as a data structure","timeRequired":"PT5M18S","description":"Review the definition of a stack as well as how you can create and traverse stacks in C#. Understanding the different use cases where you can use a stack to manage your data can help you decipher the right coding scenarios and technical interview solutions to use it in."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Use queues in technical interviews","timeRequired":"PT5M4S","description":"Review the queue data structure and how queues are represented in C#. Understanding how to use this data structure along with its advantages and disadvantages can help you determine if queues are helpful for your solution to a given technical interview problem."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Master hash-based structures","timeRequired":"PT5M21S","description":"Hash-based structures are the most commonly used data structures in technical interviews. Review the hash-based data structures that exist in C# as well as the underlying technology that makes hashing possible. Discover the coding scenarios where using a Dictionary or a Hashtable is most beneficial."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Solution: Generate binary numbers","timeRequired":"PT5M45S","description":"Learn how to leverage the queue data structure to create a program that generates a given amount of binary numbers. Walk through a solution that reads and writes data to a queue in order to determine the next binary number to generate and print to the user."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Solution: Matching parentheses","timeRequired":"PT4M50S","description":"Learn how to use a stack in C# to determine if a piece of text has matching parentheses. Using stacks to keep track of state data can be a useful strategy in technical interviews."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Solution: Find the most repeated word","timeRequired":"PT5M39S","description":"Learn how to use various hash-based data structures in C# to create a program that finds the most repeated word in a given piece of text. This technical interview question can be asked in many different forms, such as asking for the most repeated character or most repeated phrase contained in a piece of data, but the strategies involved in the solutions to all of these problems are very similar."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Master abstraction for technical interviews","timeRequired":"PT7M19S","description":"Master abstraction through practice by using abstract classes in your programs. Abstraction is one of the key principles of object-oriented design and is often asked about in coding interviews. Abstraction can also help you level up your technical solutions."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Add encapsulation to your programs to impress interviewers","timeRequired":"PT4M11S","description":"Review how to add encapsulation to your programs with public and private access modifiers. Encapsulation is a foundational concept in object-oriented programming and while it might be asked about in your technical interview, using encapsulation in your coding solution in the right scenarios can help you stand out as a candidate."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Leverage inheritance in your technical interview solutions","timeRequired":"PT8M59S","description":"Discover how to make your code more reusable and scalable by adding inheritance. One essential principle of object-oriented design is inheritance and leveraging this concept in your C# whiteboard interviews can impress your interviewer."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Explore the polymorphism built into C#","timeRequired":"PT3M3S","description":"Learn how C# uses polymorphism by diving into the built-in ArrayList class and a few built-in interfaces. You only have a few seconds to make a positive impression, so you need to maximize your chances of getting noticed."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Resume length","timeRequired":"PT1M47S","description":"Submitting a resume that's too long or too short can negatively impact your chances of success. In this video, learn how long the optimal resume length is in relation to your job experience."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"The difference between a resume and a CV","timeRequired":"PT1M32S","description":"There are a few important distinctions between a resume and a CV. To maximize your chance at success it's important to understand the differences between the two."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Contact information","timeRequired":"PT2M34S","description":"If a recruiter likes your resume, they'll want to contact you. Thus, it's imperative to list your up-to-date contact information in an easy-to-find place. In this video, examine which contact information you need to add to your resume."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Education","timeRequired":"PT4M3S","description":"This is an era where you don't need a college degree to get a development job. So how do you list your education experience if you're self-taught or attended a Bootcamp? This video can help you display your education, regardless of the path you took."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Work experience","timeRequired":"PT2M54S","description":"Work experience is the most important aspect of your resume because it exemplifies the impact you had on a project. In this video, take a look at the best format for listing work experience and learn how to tackle this section if you don't have relevant work experience."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Relevant skills","timeRequired":"PT2M42S","description":"Technical and non-technical skills are an important piece of your resume and can make or break whether you get an interview. It's also one of the trickiest areas of the resume to master. This video can help you determine which skills you should list on your resume."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Awards and certifications","timeRequired":"PT1M45S","description":"If you've won any awards in your career, it's important to include them on your resume. Awards tell a future employer that you've gone above and beyond on a project, and this is your time to showcase them. Certifications are proof of completion of a course or training and can exemplify your skills."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"The importance of word choice","timeRequired":"PT3M35S","description":"The words you use to represent yourself and your achievements have a big impact on the success of your resume. In this video, examine how to write effective statements and formulate concise statements."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"State your impact","timeRequired":"PT1M46S","description":"It's more important to state your impact on a project rather than your responsibilities as it shows a hiring manager what you bring to the table. This video can help you determine how to turn responsibilities into impact statements."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Word processors","timeRequired":"PT2M37S","description":"Word processors are a quick and easy tool for creating a resume, and they're often free! This video showcases some popular word processors for building a resume."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Resume builders","timeRequired":"PT2M24S","description":"Resume builders take the process of building a resume and break it down into digestible steps. There are many benefits to using resume builders. This video showcases a few resume builders for you to use."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Visual design tools","timeRequired":"PT1M54S","description":"If you've got some design skills, you can showcase them by leveraging a visual design tool to build a custom resume. These tools are often more difficult to learn and use, and generally cost money. In this video, check out a few visual design tools you can build your resume with if you're looking for a challenge."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Typography","timeRequired":"PT3M6S","description":"Choosing a nice font family is important, but there are some considerations to be made when checking out different fonts. This video examines the most important aspects of good typography and helps you pick the right one for your resume."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Color","timeRequired":"PT2M19S","description":"Adding pops of color to your resume can help it stand out from other candidates, but choosing the right colors and using them in the right way can ensure you have a successful resume."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Layout","timeRequired":"PT1M41S","description":"How you structure your resume has a big impact on which information recruiters hone in on. This video examines a few different layouts you can use to showcase your skills and present yourself in the best possible manner."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"File format","timeRequired":"PT1M55S","description":"Once you've created your resume, it's important to export it in a proper format. This video can teach you about the different file formats you can use and which is the best option for you."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Summary or objective","timeRequired":"PT1M39S","description":"It's not uncommon to see a resume with a brief overview paragraph introducing yourself and explaining what type of job you're seeking. In this video, discover whether you need an overview section on your resume."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Extracurricular activities or hobbies","timeRequired":"PT1M20S","description":"When creating a professional resume you can list some extracurricular activities or hobbies that speak to you as a person. In this video, examine whether or not you should include extracurricular activities, and if so, which."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"References","timeRequired":"PT1M34S","description":"Having references who can speak highly of your character and work is important, but you don't necessarily need to include them on your resume. In this video, discover why you might want to omit references from your resume."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Photo","timeRequired":"PT57S","description":"One of the biggest debates in the world of resumes is whether or not you should include a photo. This video explains the pros and cons of including a photo on your resume."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Graduation year","timeRequired":"PT41S","description":"Including formal education on your resume is important, however, is it necessary to include your graduation date? In this video, explore the pros and cons of including your graduation date."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"LinkedIn","timeRequired":"PT1M56S","description":"Once you have a \"paper\" resume, you can use professional networking tools like LinkedIn to validate your skills and grow your network. This video examines how you can leverage tools like LinkedIn to reinforce your skills and accomplishments."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"GitHub","timeRequired":"PT53S","description":"GitHub is a popular tool for showcasing your coding projects and having a few coding projects which showcase differing skill sets can complement your resume."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Personal portfolio or website","timeRequired":"PT1M10S","description":"A personal website or portfolio is a great way to add more context to your resume. This video examines the benefits of having a personal website and how it can positively impact the success of your resume."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Next steps with your resume","timeRequired":"PT43S"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2445,"ratingValue":4.7,"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},"review":[{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Ademola Oluwatoye","jobTitle":"Information Technology Specialist & Innovation Manager","url":"https://uk.linkedin.com/in/ademola-oluwatoye-00a0666a"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":5},"reviewBody":"Fantastic","datePublished":"2024-02-29T22:53:20.172Z","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"LinkedIn"},"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Gideon Odiokine","jobTitle":"Frontend Developer | React.js @ Sterling Bank","url":"https://ng.linkedin.com/in/gideonodiokine"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":5},"reviewBody":"Inspired and enlightened by this podcast content. They need to help others understand what they do. In this video, learn how the communication skills in this course can benefit both your daily life and career."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Why don't people understand?","timeRequired":"PT2M37S","description":"Gaps in experience, motivation, perspective, and style stand between technical information and its intended audiences. In this video, learn how such gaps hinder your work and explore a roadmap for how the course can help to overcome them."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Three types of intelligence","timeRequired":"PT2M18S","description":"Theories of intelligence abound; a practical one divides into smarts for ideas, people, and things. In this video, learn how to appreciate how people with different bit of intelligence think and communicate, and will better appreciate the strengths of each."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"The joys and sorrows of groupthink","timeRequired":"PT2M45S","description":"Just as \"birds of a feather flock together,\" people self-optimize into groups with similar goals, values, and thinking. In this video, learn how to accept how moving outside of your own flock can cause some loss of that optimization while being able to exploit the new perspectives it brings."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"A note about money and time","timeRequired":"PT2M34S","description":"\"How long will this take?\" is a dreaded question, as people outside a specialty don't understand the steps needed to go from idea to completion. In this video, learn how to break down resource estimates in sensible ways, as well as explain why some resources can't be well estimated."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Using words that people know","timeRequired":"PT2M38S","description":"Jargon pervades every technical profession; it speeds up communication among those \"in the know\", but also excludes those without specific training. In this video, learn how to recognize when you're guilty of using jargon and gain skills to translate to simpler language when necessary."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Don't dumb down, smarten up","timeRequired":"PT2M24S","description":"People who explain technology often feel they're \"dumbing down\" to reach those without experience in their specialty. In this video, learn how the \"beginner's mind\" of your audience requires effort to reach and gain respect for the process of reaching them."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"The magic of stories","timeRequired":"PT3M","description":"Storytelling is humanity's oldest way to convey information‚Äîand it remains the most powerful, translating abstract ideas into images and feelings. In this video, learn how to relate your work to everyday life in small ways (through analogy) and big (through stories)."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Why don't they care?","timeRequired":"PT2M24S","description":"The details of technology matter to those who do it, but showing how it matters to others is often a struggle. In this video, learn how to uncover what your audiences find important, and learn tricks to connect it to your own work."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Reigniting hope in technology","timeRequired":"PT2M27S","description":"Often people are hostile toward technology because of past failures. They tried some \"innovation\" and were frustrated or even harmed. In this video, learn how to help audiences surmount such trauma with \"quick wins\" that give hope that technical solutions can, in fact, succeed."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Leading through enthusiasm","timeRequired":"PT2M32S","description":"Even if audiences can't understand the technical details of your work, you can infect them with the joy that drives you to do it. In this video, learn how to go below the surface to remember the underlying reasons for why you do what you do and feel more comfortable taking audiences on that journey."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Your success isn't their success","timeRequired":"PT2M30S","description":"\"Faster\" and \"cheaper\" are admirable technical goals, but often they're not as important as business priorities, market pressures, and personal preference. In this video, learn how to expand your vision of what \"success\" means to better align it with your audience's."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Engineers vs. managers","timeRequired":"PT2M15S","description":"A famous joke illustrates how widely two sets of criteria can differ, and yet both be valid. In this video, learn how to dig deeper into an audience's definition of \"success\" and be better-prepared to accept that audience's expectations."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Finding shared goals","timeRequired":"PT2M16S","description":"You're a \"seller\" when you promote your project, but you're also a buyer when evaluating tools and technologies. In this video, learn how to use your skills as a buyer and improve how you communicate your offerings."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"You are both buyer and seller","timeRequired":"PT2M44S","description":"Once you've determined what an audience wants ‚Äîand finding that it differs from what was expected‚Äîhow does one connect the dots? In this video, learn how to figure out what parts of a technical solution are useful to a project and adapt those that can be made better."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Learning about your audience","timeRequired":"PT2M32S","description":"A little preparation goes a long way in helping you tune your message for better understanding. Adrienne discusses the common sentiments developers share about code reviews and, despite these sentiments, why code reviews are still an essential process we should strive to improve."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Goal 1: Catch design flaws","timeRequired":"PT3M28S","description":"Learn what a design flaw is and how to spot it in a code review. Design flaws are one of the most important things to catch and point out in a code review, as they negatively affect an application in a more serious way."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Goal 2: Ensure code clarity and coherence","timeRequired":"PT1M36S","description":"Learn to recognize when code is clear and coherent, as well as when it isn't. It's important to ensure that code is understandable and maintainable for all who have to deal with it."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Goal 3: Validate necessity","timeRequired":"PT2M26S","description":"There are a variety of reasons why unnecessary or untimely code might make it all the way to the code review process; knowing how to recognize it can help you keep your code base clean."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Goal 4: Confirm functionality","timeRequired":"PT3M7S","description":"Code reviews, at minimum, act as an approval that verifies the code changes about to be merged does, in fact, what the developer intends it to do."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What's a team working agreement?","timeRequired":"PT2M19S","description":"Discover what this living document is and why it is an essential piece of documentation for your team. Establishing this tangible and enforceable set of guidelines that has buy-in from your whole team keeps your code review process consistent and fair."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Why does my team need a team working agreement?","timeRequired":"PT2M5S","description":"Code reviews work best when there is a vetted, clear process and a consensus among the team to equally enforce it. Understanding this and getting every member of your development team on board is key to creating a repeatable, productive, and fair code review process."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Challenge: Create a team agreement","timeRequired":"PT1M1S"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Solution: Sample team agreement","timeRequired":"PT1M20S"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Subjectivity","timeRequired":"PT2M33S","description":"This video defines what subjectivity means in the context of a code review. Subjective code review comments are common starting points for arguments or tension between teammates."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Tone of voice","timeRequired":"PT2M7S","description":"See how to recognize how important communication and writing skills are, especially in an out of context, humanless environment like a code review. How you say something is just as important as what you say, especially when giving feedback or substantiated critique."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Process loopholes","timeRequired":"PT2M55S","description":"Identify scenarios or practices that contribute to unfair and inconsistent code reviews. Process loopholes decrease the value of code reviews and leave developers discouraged."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Objectivity","timeRequired":"PT2M57S","description":"This video defines what objectivity means in the context of a code review and teaches you how to construct objective code review comments. Focusing on the code and referring back to team-vetted, established code review goals make the code review process more pragmatic and efficient."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Tools of objectivity","timeRequired":"PT3M16S","description":"Find out what tools and automations can assist (or take over!) your objectivity needs. There are so many developer tools built with this purpose in mind; allowing tools to handle objective tasks (like pointing out syntax errors) make us more likely to fix them as they happen. We're also more likely to listen!"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"TL;DR Don't be a jerk!","timeRequired":"PT4M1S","description":"Learn how to master writing any kind of code review comment, even constructive feedback. There's always a pragmatic way to give this feedback in a productive way!"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Team working agreement to the rescue!","timeRequired":"PT1M29S","description":"Discover how to establish and formalize an enforceable code review process. With buy-in from the whole team and a clear, detailed process laid out, process loopholes should be minimized and hopefully eradicated for good."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Challenge: Your code review challenge","timeRequired":"PT34S"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Solution: Your code review challenge","timeRequired":"PT41S"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Your code reviews","timeRequired":"PT1M17S"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":116,"ratingValue":4.7,"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},"review":[{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Chelsey Smith","jobTitle":"Sr. Software Engineer","url":"https://www.linkedin.com/in/chelsey-smith-67870356"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":2},"reviewBody":"GitHub resources do not reflect what is shown in course...","datePublished":"2023-04-28T17:14:36.013Z","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"LinkedIn"},"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Kateryna Yavna","jobTitle":"Junior Software Engineer, .Net, Sitecore","url":"https://ua.linkedin.com/in/kateryna-yavna-227bb4212"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":5},"reviewBody":"Very detailed about code review.","datePublished":"2023-02-21T17:58:44.292Z","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"LinkedIn"},"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Sobuza kolotsane","jobTitle":"Senior Lead VAS Engineer at ETL","url":"https://ls.linkedin.com/in/sobuza-kolotsane-002bb025"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":4},"reviewBody":"very good","datePublished":"2022-09-07T14:56:21.768Z","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"LinkedIn"},"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1}],"video":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Code reviews: heated, but needed - When someone understands the history it enables them to describe the sustainability agenda to others, and get them on board."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Setting the scope of sustainability","timeRequired":"PT4M39S","description":"After watching this video, you will be able to explain the scope of the sustainability agenda. When someone understands the scope of the sustainability agenda, they are able to describe the change that needs to be made and explain the context in which this needs to be done."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Benefits of becoming a sustainability champion","timeRequired":"PT4M37S","description":"After watching this video, you will be able to describe the unfolding changes to the sustainability agenda. It helps everyone to realize the global change that they are part of and motivates them to become sustainability champions."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Carbon neutral strategy","timeRequired":"PT3M47S","description":"After watching this video, you will be able to explain what a carbon neutral strategy is. When you understand the components and issues with a carbon neutral strategy, you will be able to locate where to start and also be ready to consider technology options for the delivery of the sustainability agenda."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Explaining your sustainable strategy","timeRequired":"PT1M55S","description":"After watching this video, you will be able to contrast carbon neutral with net zero and the need to explain the choice of sustainability strategy chosen. Irrespective of the chosen strategy, it is important to explain and document the choices made in order to create both near-term and long-term emission goals."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Which gases matter?","timeRequired":"PT4M13S","description":"After watching this video, you will know what needs to be measured in order to cut emissions and deliver on net zero. You will be ready to understand the emission gases you need to focus on, measure, and reduce when you have learned the content of this video."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Creating emission goals","timeRequired":"PT4M9S","description":"After watching this video, you will be able to explain the current state of the art in the marketplace for carbon reduction plans and create an emission baseline for your business or business unit. Get ready to express the need to create both near-term and long-term goals, the key components of a roadmap toward net zero."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"No greenwashing","timeRequired":"PT3M54S","description":"After watching this video, you will be able to explain the need to ensure how to ensure your emission goals are not greenwashing. You will know how to differentiate your net zero approach from best practices in the market and understand why avoiding greenwashing is important."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Unlocking emissions","timeRequired":"PT3M1S","description":"After watching this video, you will be able to utilize the technology considerations you have already identified to choose the base technology stack which will be needed to be deployed. This technology landscape will apply for your organization to deliver your organization's sustainability agenda."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Emissions recommendations","timeRequired":"PT3M31S","description":"After watching this video, you will be able to describe what the components of the emission commitments are. Scope 3 emissions are the most difficult to identify and capture. This video provides a recommended starting point for Scope 3 emissions for every organization. When you have a recommended start point for Scope 3 emissions, it allows you to understand the majority of the emissions removal value chain."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What‚Äôs a SAR?","timeRequired":"PT3M7S","description":"After watching this video, you will be able to describe the technology needed to create a sustainability action report. This is an opportunity to cross-check the technology assumptions made earlier and understand any gaps and overlaps."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Tech is essential","timeRequired":"PT3M22S","description":"After watching this video, you will be able to explain the components of the sustainability action report. This reinforces all of the learning from previous videos and scopes the creation, delivery, and maintenance of the sustainability action report which the technology needs to orchestrate."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"SAR outline","timeRequired":"PT5M37S","description":"After watching this video, you will be able to describe the construction of the report itself which you need to use the chosen technology stack to create, monitor and maintain. This is the point at which a delivery schedule for the sustainability action report can be created and organizational and technology readiness confirmed."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Organizational delivery","timeRequired":"PT3M47S","description":"After watching this video, you will be able to explain how to deliver the sustainability action report. Use this knowledge to recommend the steps needed to implement the sustainability action report across the organization."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Tracking with technology","timeRequired":"PT5M28S","description":"After watching this video, you will be able to explain the business processes the implementation of the tracking technology will have on ways of working in the organization. The impact of the tracking technology across the organizational business processes can now be planned and any change planning can be implemented."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Creating champions","timeRequired":"PT4M24S","description":"After watching this video, you will be able to mobilize the whole organization with the chosen technology stack being the enabler. At this point, it will be possible to demonstrate the delivery benefits of producing the sustainability action report at an organizational level and the likely emergence of sustainability champions."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"A post-pandemic world","timeRequired":"PT3M28S","description":"This video will set the context for the recent changes the pandemic has introduced across the world to the sustainability agenda. You will understand Scope 4 emissions and how they need to be considered in the organization's sustainability plans."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Future of work","timeRequired":"PT3M24S","description":"This video will outline the impact of Scope 4 emissions across the sustainability agenda, driven by changes in the future of work. You will begin to appreciate the contribution organizational sustainability initiative have on the global sustainability agenda, giving you the ability to propose organizational goals which support near-term sustainability goals."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Changing society","timeRequired":"PT3M21S","description":"This video will explain that this is just the start of the sustainability journey and encourage a focus on both near-term and long-term goals. This allows you to better plan to integrate more inclusive practices into your team."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Working with established stakeholders","timeRequired":"PT4M49S","description":"In this video, learn about the challenges of working with established stakeholders around inclusion. In this video, learn how to make sure this work is accounted for, promotable, and doesn't become a second shift for your marginalized staff members."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Knowing when your voice isn't needed","timeRequired":"PT4M32S","description":"Leaders interested in inclusion, are likely passionate about issues around inclusion. After watching this video, you'll be eager to get started with your Data Analytics skills learning journey."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Defining data analysis and roles in data analysis","timeRequired":"PT3M24S","description":"This video helps you understand the different roles in data, the common skills for those roles, and the different paths and related skills for data workers, analysts, engineers, architects, and scientists."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Developing data fluency","timeRequired":"PT2M28S","description":"This video explains what what the difference between data literate and data fluent actually means for you as a data analyst."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Understanding how data governance impacts the data analyst","timeRequired":"PT3M26S","description":"This video teaches the core values of a solid data governance plan and how to deal with a lack of data governance as a data professional."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Understanding the importance of data quality","timeRequired":"PT2M50S","description":"This video discusses the importance of data quality and how to analyze your data for quality, i.e., data profiling."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"What is BI and the value to business?","timeRequired":"PT2M48S","description":"This video goes over how data drives business intelligence and how it provides value through the collection, storing, and analysis of data that an organization needs to drive business decisions."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How are business analytics and BI different?","timeRequired":"PT2M44S","description":"This video shows you how business intelligence and business analytics are different factors of a data informed business. Intelligence is overall the data of the organization, and analytics are the future trends and anticipation of outcomes."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"How data can provide intelligence to the organization","timeRequired":"PT2M33S","description":"This video presents a pratical overview of data as a living and intelligent option to drive businesses forward."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Understanding the value of data-driven decision-making","timeRequired":"PT2M45S","description":"This video covers how data can inform decision making, as well as the impact of not using data to drive decisions."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Questioning techniques to collect the right data","timeRequired":"PT3M4S","description":"In data, bi, and analytics, the questions are everything. This video shows you techniques that drive the proper way to form questions."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Discovering and interpreting existing data","timeRequired":"PT3M22S","description":"Data is everywhere, but finding the right data and interpreting it correctly to drive better decisions is a key skill."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Data sources and structures","timeRequired":"PT2M54S","description":"A data analyst needs to understand how data is collected and stored, and that not all data fits neatly into massive data systems, but must be identified and prepared for use. This video discusses the variations of files, data sources, and data systems."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Describing data best practices","timeRequired":"PT5M25S","description":"Identification, documentation, validation, and verification are key best practices with any data set or data project."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Assessing and adapting the data for transformation","timeRequired":"PT3M22S","description":"Data tools have an expectation that data is structured and consistent in the field or column. Learn how to quickly profile data to determine what steps you should take to transform your data."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Understanding the rules of the data","timeRequired":"PT4M10S","description":"It's important to understand what factors inside the workplace can impact the data and how you can account for that when transformations occur. For example, a new policy might increase or decrease values when it takes effect."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Tips on preparing the data in Excel","timeRequired":"PT8M16S","description":"This video shows you how to leverage the tools in Excel and PowerQuery to tranform your data into powerful structures that you can use for data analysis."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Transforming data in Excel with Power Query","timeRequired":"PT5M48S","description":"This video explains how to use functions in Power Query to provide data that you need or data that doesn't yet exist."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Transforming data in SQL","timeRequired":"PT6M16S","description":"This video goes over how to build queries in SQL with joins and how to read a basic select statement, using select, from, where, and order by."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Transforming data in Power BI","timeRequired":"PT7M26S","description":"This video covers how to transform and combine data in PowerBI using joins and calculations."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Common cleaning and transformation","timeRequired":"PT2M48S","description":"This video discusses common commands, like how to combine fields, clean out pesky spaces, and do basic logical functions and address nulls."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Using built-in functions","timeRequired":"PT7M30S","description":"We don't have to calculate every function we'll ever need. The built-in functions provide us a lot calculations."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Relational databases","timeRequired":"PT2M14S","description":"This video explains what relational databases are and what data analysts need to know about leveraging relational databases for reporting."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Modeling data for Power BI","timeRequired":"PT5M4S","description":"This video shows you how to build a basic model in PowerBI with an understanding of cardinality and the benefits of modeling."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Master data management","timeRequired":"PT2M9S","description":"This video discusses how to leverage bad data quality by creating a method for master data management when one doesn't exist."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Unstructured data","timeRequired":"PT2M46S","description":"This video provides practical examples of unstructured data and explains how and why it exists."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Visualization methods and best practices","timeRequired":"PT3M10S","description":"This video covers some standard best practices for any data visualization and what to do on any visual of data."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Creating reports to visualize your data over pages","timeRequired":"PT4M28S","description":"Lines of data that have been neatly calculated and provided with purpose can have a large impact to meetings, as can detailed investigation of the data. This video examines the benefits of paginated reports and building basic reports."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Creating a dashboards for reporting","timeRequired":"PT8M59S","description":"Dashboards are interactive. When designed properly ,they answer a lot of questions and drive us to interact with not only the data but also the business."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Gathering requirements for visualizations","timeRequired":"PT2M56S","description":"This video goes over how to use mockups and wireframing to produce better visualizations."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Presenting data challenges effectively to others","timeRequired":"PT3M22S","description":"This video focuses on teaching you how to communicate challenges with the data and how to overcome the challenges and gain insight."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Finalizing dashboards","timeRequired":"PT5M7S","description":"The difference between a useable dashboard and one that never gets used is finalizing the dashboard and really thinking through the user experience. This video goes over how to remove filters, add tooltips, and ensure items are named properly."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Adding dashboard filters","timeRequired":"PT2M46S"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Modifying dashboard tooltips","timeRequired":"PT5M1S"},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Data workers","timeRequired":"PT1M57S","description":"This video covers data workers: people who use and manage data like spreadsheets or CSV files every day to complete their job role."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Data analysts","timeRequired":"PT2M33S","description":"This video talks about data analysts: people who have access to more data and internal systems, whose primary job is to analyze data, and who have some basic stats involved in their role."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Data engineers","timeRequired":"PT1M51S","description":"This video explains the roles of data engineers: people who build data sets and likely share the skills of an analyst, but may or may not have the stats components. Data engineers likely design databases and data sources for further research."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Data scientists","timeRequired":"PT1M51S","description":"The top tier in data analytics, data scientists leverage all other roles. They have all the skills of the worker, analyst, engineer, and they likely have heavier math, stats, and coding skills."},{"@type":"Syllabus","name":"Next steps and additional resources","timeRequired":"PT34S"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":26436,"ratingValue":4.7,"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},"review":[{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Pooja M","jobTitle":"M S Ramaiah College of Arts, Science and Commerce","url":"https://in.linkedin.com/in/contact-pooja-m"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":5},"reviewBody":"good","datePublished":"2024-10-11T13:09:36.347Z","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"LinkedIn"},"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Shubham Patil","jobTitle":"--","url":"https://in.linkedin.com/in/shubham-patil-32048a32b"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":5},"reviewBody":"*Introduction to Career Skills in Data Analytics*\n\nData analytics is a rapidly growing field, and organizations are seeking professionals with specialized skills to extract insights from data","datePublished":"2024-10-11T02:37:21.037Z","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"LinkedIn"},"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1},{"@type":"Review","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Amira Beltran","jobTitle":"Tech Support Analyst","url":"https://mx.linkedin.com/in/amira-beltran-valdez"},"reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":5},"reviewBody":"Creat introduction to the subject","datePublished":"2024-10-10T22:06:52.344Z","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"LinkedIn"},"bestRating":5,"worstRating":1}],"video":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Starting out with data analytics - Introduction to Career Skills in Data Analytics","author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Robin Hunt","description":"Data junkie.
